claims.text: An image shows a 282-year-old East India trading company ship returning to London for the first time since 1787.

claimReview.title: Image said to show a centuries-old ship is actually a photo of a replica - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The vessel in the photo is a replica of an 18th century Swedish ship which sank in 1745. The replica ship was built in 2005, and this image shows it on a visit to London in 2007.

claims.text: Monkeypox is ‘vaccine acquired shingles’.

claimReview.title: Monkeypox is not ‘vaccine acquired’ shingles - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Monkeypox is not the same as shingles. They are caused by two completely different viruses. However, the monkeypox virus is related to the one that causes smallpox. There’s no evidence that the Covid-19 vaccines cause monkeypox.

claims.text: Monkeypox is a side effect of the Covid-19 vaccines.

claimReview.title: No evidence Covid-19 vaccines cause monkeypox - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There is no evidence this is true. Monkeypox is caused by a virus.

claims.text: The US military has found pesticides in Moderna’s Covid-19 vaccines.

claimReview.title: The US military did not find traces of pesticides in Moderna’s Covid-19 vaccine - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This claim is false and originates from a story on a website which states it posts satirical content.

claims.text: Pictures of parked private jets are from the Davos 2022 climate change conference.

claimReview.title: Private jet pictures aren’t from Davos ‘climate change conference’ this year - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Both pictures are several years old, though one is from Davos in 2019. The World Economic Forum annual meeting in Davos is not specifically a climate change conference.

claims.text: Pictures of white vapour trails in the sky show chemtrails used for geoengineering.

claimReview.title: White lines in the sky are not ‘chemtrails’ - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not true. These white lines are contrails, formed when water vapour from aircraft engines freezes at high altitudes.

claims.text: Actor Denzel Washington said: “You’ll never be criticized by someone who is doing more than you. You’ll always be criticized by someone doing less. Remember that.”

claimReview.title: No evidence Denzel Washington quote about being criticised is real - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There is no evidence of him ever saying this.

claims.text: Sigmund Freud once said: “Before you diagnose yourself with depression or low self-esteem, first make sure you are not, in fact, surrounded by assholes.”

claimReview.title: No evidence Sigmund Freud said viral quote about depression - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There is no evidence Mr Freud ever said this. The earliest appearance of the quote appears to be a tweet posted in 2010, with the Twitter user claiming to have invented it herself.

claims.text: A Dyson Supersonic hair dryer is available for just £1.78 in an AO.com clearance sale.

claimReview.title: Dyson clearance sale on Facebook has nothing to do with Dyson - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Both AO and Dyson say that this has nothing to do with them. We can find no trace of the company that claims to be behind the offer.

claims.text: Everybody that applies for a passport receives it within four to six weeks.

claimReview.title: Not everybody is getting their passports issued in four to six weeks - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: While the majority of applications are completed within this timescale, thousands are not.

claims.text: When parents arrive on an RNLI lifeguarded beach they should take their child to the lifeguard hut where they can get a free wristband that their parents’ phone number can be written on in waterproof ink.

claimReview.title: RNLI lifeguarded beaches don’t all provide wristbands with contact details for children - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Some RNLI lifeguards may provide these wristbands but it is not a nationwide policy.

claims.text: All RNLI lifeguards are DBS checked.

claimReview.title: RNLI lifeguarded beaches don’t all provide wristbands with contact details for children - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct. The RNLI says it’s a requirement of employment that its lifeguards have a DBS check.

claims.text: A single mother on the National Living Wage, with two children, who’s renting, will actually be £1,600 better off in 2022 compared to 2021 because of recent government changes.

claimReview.title: Was the Attorney General right to say that a single mother will be £1,600 better off? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Ms Braverman hasn’t explained the figure she gave, which means it’s impossible to say for sure how reliable it is. But it appears similar to a figure the Treasury has previously used. That referred to the beneficial effect to a mother of some changes in tax and government support. It did not mean that the mother will necessarily be better off overall in 2022.

claims.text: Images show incredibly detailed photographs of the sun.

claimReview.title: Facebook post does show real images of the sun - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: These appear to be real images of the sun taken by an astrophotographer, although they may have been significantly processed with software.

claims.text: 72,000 jobs have been delivered by Crossrail.

claimReview.title: How many jobs has Crossrail created? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: That figure’s close to TfL’s official estimate. Downing Street says the PM’s claim was based on comments from Crossrail CEO Mark Wild, who actually said 75,000 people have worked on the wider Crossrail project.

claims.text: “Most” Britons will have “lost obesity battle” in 20 years’ time.

claimReview.title: Most Britons are not projected to be obese by 2040 - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Around 36% of Britons aged 16+ are projected to be obese or severely obese by 2040.

claims.text: Smallpox is the only disease eradicated by humans.

claimReview.title: Smallpox not the only infectious disease eradicated by humans - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This claim is false. At least one other infectious disease, rinderpest, has been eradicated by humans.

claims.text: White vapour lines in the sky are chemtrails, not clouds.

claimReview.title: A picture of the sky does not show ‘chemtrails’ - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The lines are not chemtrails, but clouds of ice crystals left by aeroplanes, known as contrails.

claims.text: The Washington Post published an article headlined “This dog is the new face of online homophobia”.

claimReview.title: Fake Washington Post screenshot says dachshund is the ‘face of online homophobia’ - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The Washington Post never published such an article and the screenshot has been fabricated. A different website did publish an article with the same headline though.

claims.text: The Chancellor’s Spring Statement left the average household £2,600 a year worse off.

claimReview.title: Shadow cabinet member uses misleading £2,600 cost of living figure on BBC, ITV and Sky - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This figure appears to be based on a previous Labour estimate for how much worse off families will be this year, which used unreliable assumptions and excluded changes to wages and benefits. Independent estimates suggest the average household will be significantly worse off in 2022/23, but by less than Labour’s figure of £2,620.

claims.text: Pfizer did not recommend its Covid-19 vaccine for pregnant or breastfeeding women.

claimReview.title: Post claiming the Pfizer vaccine has only a 12% efficacy rate is inaccurate - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Evidence from studies conducted during the vaccine rollout show the vaccine to be safe for use during pregnancy and breastfeeding.

claims.text: Documents released by Pfizer show an alarming amount of stillbirths and deaths in pregnant women.

claimReview.title: Post claiming the Pfizer vaccine has only a 12% efficacy rate is inaccurate - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: While pregnant women were initially excluded from Pfizer’s large-scale clinical trials, subsequent studies have not shown an increase in stillbirths or deaths in pregnant women who received the Covid-19 vaccine.

claims.text: More people are in work than before the Covid-19 pandemic.

claimReview.title: Government minister made misleading claim about employment figures - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The total number of people in employment is 504,000 people lower than before the pandemic.

claims.text: Green levies make up 25% of our energy costs.

claimReview.title: Green levy costs do not make up 25% of energy bills - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This figure is inaccurate. Green levies represent a proportion of environmental and social obligation costs, which account for less than 8% of an average energy bill’s costs under the current price cap. They did make up 25% of the 2021 average electricity bill.

claims.text: BlackRock now owns 75% of ancestry.com.

claimReview.title: BlackRock doesn’t own 75% of Ancestry - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: A 75% stake in Ancestry was acquired by a different, though similarly named investment management firm, Blackstone, in 2020.

claims.text: Agenda 21 means people can’t have private property, mostly, or land of their own.

claimReview.title: The UN doesn’t have a plan to abolish private land ownership - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not true. Agenda 21 is a non-binding plan intending to improve sustainable development. It explicitly mentions respecting land ownership rights.

claims.text: The owners of Ancestry have access to the DNA collected by the site’s DNA testing service.

claimReview.title: BlackRock doesn’t own 75% of Ancestry - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Blackstone has said it will not access or share DNA or family tree data from Ancestry.

claims.text: New documents reveal that Pfizer’s Covid-19 vaccine has just 12% efficacy.

claimReview.title: Post claiming the Pfizer vaccine has only a 12% efficacy rate is inaccurate - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This appears to be based on a misinterpretation of a document showing results from a clinical trial first published in 2020. The clinical trial showed the vaccine’s efficacy rate was 95% from seven days after the second dose, although the latest data relating to the Omicron variant does show lower efficacy which reduces significantly over time.

claims.text: Jean-Claude Van Damme said when he converted to Islam he didn’t get any job offers but that wasn’t important and he doesn’t regret it.

claimReview.title: There’s no evidence Jean-Claude Van Damme is Muslim - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There is no evidence he said this or has converted to Islam.

claims.text: £37 billion has been spent on NHS Test and Trace, and it’s not clear how this money was used.

claimReview.title: £37 billion was the two-year budget for NHS Test and Trace, not how much was spent - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This figure was the budget for the scheme in its first two years—around £29.5 billion was actually spent. While detailed figures for 2021/22 have not yet been published, the vast majority of spending in the scheme’s first year went on testing.

claims.text: John Lennon once said: “When I was 5 years old, my mother always told me that happiness was the key to life. When I went to school, they asked me what I wanted to be when I grew up. I wrote down ‘happy’. They told me I didn’t understand the assignment, and I told them they didn’t understand life.”

claimReview.title: No evidence John Lennon quote about happiness is real - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There’s no evidence of John Lennon ever telling this anecdote.

claims.text: A poster which appears to be from the government says people who have noticed “declining health” since their Covid-19 vaccine and who weren’t made aware of the risks are entitled to compensation of £120,000.

claimReview.title: Facebook image promoting vaccine damage payments scheme is not an official government poster - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The poster is not an official government one. It links to the genuine vaccine damage payment scheme, but that’s for people severely disabled by certain vaccines (including those for Covid-19).

claims.text: An inspirational quote that begins “None of us are getting out of here alive” came from Sir Anthony Hopkins.

claimReview.title: No evidence inspiring Facebook quote comes from Sir Anthony Hopkins - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: We can find no evidence for this. The quote appears to come from a 2015 Facebook post by Nanea Hoffman, the founder of an online lifestyle brand.

claims.text: The opening lines of Amber Heard’s testimony were taken from the 1999 movie The Talented Mr Ripley.

claimReview.title: Amber Heard did not quote The Talented Mr Ripley during trial - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Ms Heard did not begin her testimony with this quote, and did not say these words at any point during her first day on the stand.

claims.text: Mandatory Covid-19 vaccinations have just been passed “under the radar” by the European Council.

claimReview.title: Covid vaccines haven’t been mandated in the EU ‘under the radar’ under ‘Resolution 2361’ - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is based on a misreading of a resolution passed by a completely different organisation. The resolution explicitly states citizens should be informed that vaccines aren’t mandatory.

claims.text: Most teachers are suffering from depression.

claimReview.title: Reports that ‘most teachers’ are suffering from depression are based on a self-selecting survey - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This comes from the responses of teachers who chose to complete their union's wellbeing survey and so may not be representative.

claims.text: Holidaymakers have a 50% chance of getting their passports back in a “successful and timely” manner.

claimReview.title: No hard evidence behind claim holidaymakers have 50% chance of ‘timely’ passport renewal - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There’s no hard evidence behind this figure—it’s an estimate from an economic consultancy which doesn’t appear to be based on statistical data. There are anecdotal reports of delayed renewals causing holidays to be cancelled though, amid a “surge” in demand.

claims.text: The recent rise in cases of hepatitis in children is primarily affecting children aged one month to four years old who have been actively breastfed in the last 12 months. All the children were breastfed by vaccinated mothers.

claimReview.title: No evidence hepatitis in children is caused by vaccinated breastfeeding mothers - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Recent child hepatitis cases in England are concentrated in children aged between three and five, and there is no evidence they have been breastfed in the past 12 months by vaccinated mothers. There is no evidence the cases of hepatitis are linked with the Covid-19 vaccines.

claims.text: Experts said a man who vanished after arriving at Tokyo airport with a passport issued by the country of “Taured” was from a parallel universe.

claimReview.title: A man who arrived in Japan with a fake passport did not mysteriously vanish - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: While it seems there was a real case involving a man who arrived in Japan with a fake passport, he did not vanish, and reports at the time did not say he was from a parallel universe.

claims.text: Council tax is unlawful. The Crown has no lawful authority to make demands whilst Article 61 Magna Carta 1215 is in effect. Council tax is unlawful.

claimReview.title: Article 61 of the Magna Carta doesn’t mean you don’t have to pay council tax - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Article 61 of Magna Carta is not in effect. Council tax is not unlawful, and was brought into effect by a 1992 Act of Parliament.

claims.text: Covid-19 vaccines’ effectiveness dropped from 98% to just 1% among a wider, younger population. This information appeared in the Lancet medical journal.

claimReview.title: The Lancet didn’t say Covid-19 vaccines are only 1% effective - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The Pfizer and Moderna vaccines both reported over 90% effectiveness in trials. A subsequent Lancet article argued these relative risk reduction figures should be published alongside absolute risk reduction figures, a totally different measurement which the article said were around 1 to 2 percentage points for the vaccines. The latest data relating to the Omicron variant does show vaccine effectiveness reduces significantly over time however.

claims.text: Somerset has no NHS dental care.

claimReview.title: NHS dentists are still operating in Somerset - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Somerset residents are struggling to find NHS dental surgeries accepting new patients, however NHS dental surgeries are still open in the county.

claims.text: A new Pfizer document shows the company admitting its Covid-19 vaccine is not safe for use in pregnancy or breastfeeding.

claimReview.title: ‘Pfizer document’ doesn’t show company admitting vaccines unsafe in pregnancy - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not a Pfizer document, nor is it new. It was published by the UK government in December 2020. Evidence from studies conducted during the vaccine rollout show the vaccine to be safe for use during pregnancy and breastfeeding.

claims.text: A fleet of Harrier jump jets spelt “f*** off” in formation over the Houses of Parliament after they were decommissioned.

claimReview.title: Harrier jets didn’t spell out expletive over Houses of Parliament - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The picture is false, and such a protest never happened. The farewell flypast didn’t even pass London.

claims.text: 65,000 people died of winter flu in December 2017 and January 2018.

claimReview.title: There were not 65,000 flu deaths in the winter of 2017/18 - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not accurate. Although the actual number is uncertain, official estimates suggest that it is less than half of this.

claims.text: A man was sentenced to 22 weeks in prison after a woman reported him for “continuously staring” at her on a train.

claimReview.title: Man wasn’t jailed only for staring at a woman on the train - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This only tells part of the story. The man in question was jailed under the Public Order Act for “causing intentional harassment, alarm or distress”, after staring at a woman and then also blocking her exit when she tried to leave.

claims.text: Local government councillors in England and Wales are elected using the First Past the Post system. You vote for one candidate in your local area and the candidate with the most votes wins.

claimReview.title: Some voting in local elections can pick more than one candidate - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not right, and has now been corrected on Gov.uk. While the system is First Past the Post, you vote for as many candidates as there are councillor vacancies, which can be more than one.

claims.text: Fanta Lemon is being discontinued in Europe from 28 May 2022.

claimReview.title: Fanta Lemon is not being discontinued in Europe - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not true.

claims.text: The Cancer Act 1939 stops people from discussing cancer treatments that aren’t chemotherapy, radiotherapy or surgery.

claimReview.title: 1939 Cancer Act doesn’t criminalise discussion of cancer ‘cures’ - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There is no law in the UK that limits cancer treatments to these three options, and the law only stops people advertising cures to the public, not discussing them.

claims.text: The government hasn’t gone after £11.8 billion lost to fraud and undelivered contracts during the pandemic.

claimReview.title: Keir Starmer’s GMB interview: fact checked - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Labour hasn’t clarified how this figure was calculated. It might include some money that has already been reclaimed, or is expected to be and may not be comprehensive.

claims.text: The economy isn’t growing.

claimReview.title: Keir Starmer’s GMB interview: fact checked - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: UK GDP is increasing on a monthly, quarterly and annual basis.

claims.text: The UK has the fastest economic growth in the G7.

claimReview.title: Boris Johnson’s GMB interview: fact checked - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: According to the latest data, the UK had the highest growth in 2021 among G7 nations. However this is partly due to a technicality concerning how the UK measures GDP, which increased the apparent scale of both the fall and the recovery. The UK’s economy has shrunk by about 0.4% since the start of the pandemic, making it the fifth best performing among the G7 nations.

claims.text: Boris Johnson introduced the 24 hour Freedom Pass.

claimReview.title: Boris Johnson’s GMB interview: fact checked - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: As Mayor of London, Boris Johnson did change the Freedom Pass so it applied 24 hours a day on most services, although he did not introduce it originally. Following a bailout deal between Transport for London and Mr Johnson’s government in 2020, it no longer functions 24 hours a day.

claims.text: Under the Tories, families are £2,620 worse off.

claimReview.title: Angela Rayner repeats misleading claim that families are £2,620 ‘worse off’ - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This estimate is based on unreliable assumptions, and excludes the impact of wages and benefits, which are rising overall. Independent estimates suggest the average household will be worse off in 2022/23, but by significantly less than Labour’s figure of £2,620.

claims.text: Reuters owns the Associated Press.

claimReview.title: The Rothschilds don’t own Reuters or the Associated Press - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Incorrect. The Associated Press is an independent, not-for-profit news cooperative.

claims.text: Official UKHSA data shows booster vaccines are ineffective.

claimReview.title: GB News presenter wrong about booster vaccine deaths - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is based on an inaccurate reading of a vaccine surveillance report, which specifically includes a caveat warning that the data can’t be used to determine vaccine effectiveness.

claims.text: UKHSA data also shows having a booster vaccine increases your chance of hospitalisation and death.

claimReview.title: GB News presenter wrong about booster vaccine deaths - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There may be various reasons why people who have been boosted show higher rates of hospitalisation and death, beyond the fact they have been boosted. For example, a higher proportion of elderly people, who are more vulnerable to Covid-19, have been triple-vaccinated. There is no proof that a booster vaccine increases your chance of dying or being hospitalised.

claims.text: The Rothschilds own Reuters.

claimReview.title: The Rothschilds don’t own Reuters or the Associated Press - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Incorrect. Reuters is part of Thomson Reuters, which is majority-owned by the Thomson family.

claims.text: A photo shows the Kerid volcanic crater lake in Iceland which appears to look like a giant eye.

claimReview.title: Picture of Icelandic lake has been edited - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The photo has been edited. The lake is real but has been changed to look more like an eye.

claims.text: A French news channel showed during the count for the presidential election that Marine Le Pen had more votes than Emmanuel Macron, but her votes were later reduced, suggesting electoral fraud.

claimReview.title: Clip of French TV shows technical glitch, not election fraud - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: France 2, which showed the erroneous graph, has confirmed the inconsistency in figures was due to a technical glitch.

claims.text: The House of Lords attendance allowance is £323 per day.

claimReview.title: Facebook post’s figures for the state pension and House of Lords allowance are broadly right - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct.

claims.text: The full state pension is £179.60 a week

claimReview.title: Facebook post’s figures for the state pension and House of Lords allowance are broadly right - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This was correct for the financial year when the claim was first made on Twitter. As of 6 April 2022, the correct value is £185.15.

claims.text: Rishi Sunak’s wife lives in Downing Street whilst claiming to live abroad for tax purposes.

claimReview.title: Was Rishi Sunak’s in-laws’ company a ‘beneficiary’ of a UK-India trade deal? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Akshata Murty previously lived in Downing Street but has reportedly moved to their home in West London. She has non-dom status for tax purposes, but this doesn’t mean she claims to live abroad. Non-dom status is for UK residents who are domiciled abroad, which is not the same as living there. Ms Murty recently announced she would pay UK tax on all her income.

claims.text: A photo from Ukraine shows several cars have been flipped over by the explosion of a Russian bomb, yet the building behind them looks completely undamaged, which is inconsistent with an explosion.

claimReview.title: Overturned cars in Ukraine were likely flipped by Russian forces, not explosion - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: These cars were probably not flipped over by an explosion. Eyewitnesses report that Russian forces overturned cars with tanks.

claims.text: When Boris Johnson did a £1 billion trade deal with India in May 2021, the main beneficiary was Infosys, owned by Rishi Sunak’s wife and family.

claimReview.title: Was Rishi Sunak’s in-laws’ company a ‘beneficiary’ of a UK-India trade deal? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The government announced £1 billion worth of trade and investment made by private companies between the UK and India. This included BP working for Infosys, and Infosys being one of three Indian companies creating 1,000 UK jobs.

claims.text: Photographs show that those who say that chemtrails don't exist and that it's just aeroplane fumes are wrong.

claimReview.title: Photographs of aeroplanes don’t prove existence of ‘chemtrails’ - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: False. The photographs do not show aeroplanes taking part in a chemtrails conspiracy.

claims.text: 482 Covid-19 deaths were recorded in the UK on 19 April, 508 on 20 April and 646 on 21 April.

claimReview.title: High reported Covid-19 deaths due to Easter holiday backlog - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct, but this reflects deaths occurring over the Easter Bank Holiday being processed, rather than the genuine level of daily Covid-19 deaths.

claims.text: On the government’s plan to send asylum seekers to Rwanda, David Blunkett proposed the policy first in 2004.

claimReview.title: Did David Blunkett propose sending asylum seekers abroad in 2004? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Proposals for would-be asylum seekers to the EU to be processed in centres outside the EU were pitched to member states by then-Home Secretary David Blunkett in 2003. But those plans were quite different to the government’s new plan to send asylum seekers to Rwanda.

claims.text: Families in the UK are £2,620 worse off this year.

claimReview.title: Labour election leaflets and ads wrongly claiming families are ‘£2,620 worse off’ - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This estimate is based on unreliable assumptions, and excludes the impact of wages and benefits, which are rising overall. Independent estimates suggest the average household will be worse off in 2022/23, but by significantly less than Labour’s figure of £2,620.

claims.text: There are more people in work than there were before the pandemic.

claimReview.title: Boris Johnson makes false employment claim for ninth time in Parliament - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: False. There are 600,000 fewer people in work than there were before the pandemic.

claims.text: The average age of death from Covid-19 is 82.5.

claimReview.title: Number of death certificates with only Covid-19 is a bad estimate of the death toll - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Broadly correct. The median average age of deaths from Covid-19 in England and Wales is 82, and the mean age is 79.4.

claims.text: Infosys, the company owned by Rishi Sunak’s in-laws is an IT and digital solution company registered in Rwanda. The UK outsources many of its immigration processes to the company.

claimReview.title: Rishi Sunak’s in-laws’ company isn’t registered in Rwanda - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: That company is not registered in Rwanda. It has had several government contracts, but none appear to be to do with immigration.

claims.text: To the end of 2021, there have been 6,189 Covid-19 deaths where only Covid-19 was entered on the death certificate.

claimReview.title: Number of death certificates with only Covid-19 is a bad estimate of the death toll - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is the number for England and Wales, not the UK.

claims.text: People should get much higher state pensions because both employees and employers paid into them, and with interest, that should generate millions in income for pensioners when they retire.

claimReview.title: Viral pensions post has its maths all wrong - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is a fundamental misunderstanding of how state pensions work. National Insurance contributions paid by employees and employers essentially fund that year’s state pensions, plus some other benefits. Private pensions are invested and generate income.

claims.text: To the end of 2021, there have been 156,924 deaths within 28 days of a positive Covid-19 test in the UK.

claimReview.title: Number of death certificates with only Covid-19 is a bad estimate of the death toll - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Broadly correct. The true figure is 149,989.

claims.text: MPs get free healthcare, retirement packages, paid holiday and unlimited paid sick days.

claimReview.title: Viral pensions post has its maths all wrong - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: MPs can’t claim private healthcare on expenses, but can use the NHS like anyone else. They do have a workplace pension scheme. They get paid regardless of how many holiday or sick days they take.

claims.text: To the end of 2021, there have been 18,939 Covid-19 deaths with comorbidities in the UK.

claimReview.title: Number of death certificates with only Covid-19 is a bad estimate of the death toll - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is the number of deaths registered to the end of 2021, in England and Wales, not the UK, of people who died of Covid-19 without comorbidities, not with comorbidities.

claims.text: Those earning under £34,000 are not affected by the National Insurance (NI) rise.

claimReview.title: Working pensioners will have to pay the health and social care levy from 2023 - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: People earning around this amount will probably end up paying about the same across 2022/23 as they did in 2021/22. Those earning less will see their overall NI bill for the year decrease compared to 2021/22.

claims.text: Conversely, working pensioners are affected by the National Insurance rise.

claimReview.title: Working pensioners will have to pay the health and social care levy from 2023 - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: In 2022/23, working pensioners will not get an NI increase, as they usually don’t pay NI. They will have to pay the health and social care levy from April 2023, which is much the same as the NI increase.

claims.text: Obesity is more a determinant of how you're going to handle Covid than anything.

claimReview.title: GB News interview features misleading claims about Covid-19 and vaccines - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Studies have shown that weight is an important underlying risk factor for serious Covid-19 infections. However, age is the biggest predictive factor for serious illness.

claims.text: MPs can claim up to £3,400 towards their heating costs.

claimReview.title: There is no upper limit for how much MPs can claim to cover heating costs - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There is no upper limit on how much MPs can claim for utilities bills.

claims.text: The Great Reset is not a conspiracy theory and the World Economic Forum reveals its agenda.

claimReview.title: The Great Reset: What is it? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The World Economic Forum website does discuss a ‘Great Reset’ many times on its website, but many claims about the plan are false and amount to a conspiracy theory.

claims.text: An Irish Examiner headline claims experts say referee whistles may be to blame for “sudden heart problems” in sports players.

claimReview.title: Article claiming link between referee whistles and heart problems in athletes is fake - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The Irish Examiner has never published such an article, and there is no credible evidence of an expert describing a link between referee whistles and heart problems in athletes.

claims.text: There were 2,000 excess deaths in New Zealand while the vaccine was being rolled out.

claimReview.title: GB News interview features misleading claims about Covid-19 and vaccines - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There were 34,932 deaths in New Zealand in 2021. This is around 2,200 higher than the five-year average from 2015 to 2019. There is no evidence the rise in deaths was caused by vaccines, and statisticians have attributed the rising death rate to the country’s ageing population.

claims.text: MPs just got a £2,000 pay rise so now get paid £86,000 a year.

claimReview.title: There is no upper limit for how much MPs can claim to cover heating costs - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: MPs did get a £2,212 pay rise, but that means they now get paid £84,144.

claims.text: A Polish study has found that mRNA vaccines may be damaging brain cells and immune systems.

claimReview.title: GB News interview features misleading claims about Covid-19 and vaccines - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This study is a pre-print, which means it has not been peer reviewed or published through a scientific journal. The website hosting the paper specifically warns the media not to report the results as conclusive.

claims.text: Dr Fauci has been arrested by US Special Forces.

claimReview.title: Dr Anthony Fauci has not been arrested by Special Forces - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not true. It appears to be a complete fabrication.

claims.text: Pictures of some damaged Ferrero chocolate eggs show those that are affected by a recent product recall related to salmonella and maggots.

claimReview.title: Pictures of chocolate eggs don’t show ‘salmonella and maggots’ - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Ferrero has recalled some Kinder products because of possible salmonella contamination, not because of maggots—but they do not include the chocolate eggs shown in these pictures, which appear to be damaged.

claims.text: MPs can claim their petrol and diesel costs on their expenses.

claimReview.title: There is no upper limit for how much MPs can claim to cover heating costs - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: MPs can claim 45p per mile for the first 10,000 miles and 25p per mile thereafter for certain journeys taken by private car.

claims.text: Covid-19 didn’t cause excess mortality, but there has been a huge uptick in the number of deaths in the middle aged and young since the start of the vaccine rollout.

claimReview.title: GB News interview features misleading claims about Covid-19 and vaccines - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Covid-19 caused a huge spike in excess mortality in England and Wales, with almost 98,000 excess deaths recorded between January 2020 and July 2021. Between the start of the vaccine roll-out and the end of 2021, deaths due to causes other than Covid-19 were above the five-year average. There is no evidence this was directly caused by the Covid-19 vaccine.

claims.text: Liking and sharing a post will get you £35 of free food from Iceland.

claimReview.title: Iceland isn’t giving away free food - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The post comes from a page pretending to be the supermarket. There’s no evidence of any such promotion on the official page.

claims.text: Boots has been given lateral flow tests the taxpayer has already paid for to sell back to us again.

claimReview.title: Boots isn’t selling lateral flow tests ‘the taxpayer has already paid for’ - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is false. Unused tests procured by NHS Test and Trace are not given to private providers, and the tests for sale in Boots are not the same as the ones used by Test and Trace.

claims.text: Nadine Dorries said people should stop moaning about the demand for food banks, and families would need to “live within their means” because “food doesn’t grow on trees”.

claimReview.title: Nadine Dorries didn’t say ‘food doesn’t grow on trees’ - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is a fake tweet.

claims.text: Employees are earning more money than before the pandemic.

claimReview.title: Thérèse Coffey wrong to claim employment is up over the pandemic - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct. Real-terms wages are up since before the pandemic, though have been broadly flat for around a year.

claims.text: 10% of criminal barristers have quit in the past year.

claimReview.title: 10% of criminal barristers haven’t quit in the past year - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This figure refers to the fall in the number of lawyers working full-time on publicly-funded criminal cases. The total number of criminal barristers has stayed stable.

claims.text: Over the past two years, unemployment is down.

claimReview.title: Thérèse Coffey wrong to claim employment is up over the pandemic - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct. It fell by 28,000 (0.1 percentage points) between the three months to February 2020 and the three months to January 2022.

claims.text: The CEO of Boots is pictured in the Bullingdon Club photograph featuring David Cameron and Boris Johnson.

claimReview.title: Boots isn’t selling lateral flow tests ‘the taxpayer has already paid for’ - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Sebastian James, the senior vice president and managing director of Boots, is reportedly in this photograph.

claims.text: Over the past two years, employment is up.

claimReview.title: Thérèse Coffey wrong to claim employment is up over the pandemic - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: False. The number of people in employment fell by 580,000 and the employment rate (the proportion of people aged 16 to 64 who are in work) fell by 1 percentage point between the three months to February 2020 and the three months to January 2022.

claims.text: Over the past two years, there are 662,000 more people on company payrolls.

claimReview.title: Thérèse Coffey wrong to claim employment is up over the pandemic - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct.

claims.text: 99.972% of the UK population did not die of Covid-19.

claimReview.title: The UK’s Covid ‘survival rate’ is lower than 99.972% - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Incorrect. About 99.76% of the UK population have not died with an underlying cause of death of Covid-19.

claims.text: On average, families will be £2,620 worse off in 2022/23.

claimReview.title: Keir Starmer wrong to say families will be £2,620 worse off this year - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This estimate is based on unreliable assumptions, and it excludes wages and benefits, which are rising. Independent estimates suggest the average household will be worse off in 2022/23, but by significantly less than Labour’s figure of £2,620.

claims.text: India does not allow its citizens to hold the citizenship of another country simultaneously. So, according to British law, Ms Murty is treated as non-domiciled for UK tax purposes.

claimReview.title: Why Rishi Sunak’s wife’s tax status isn’t a direct consequence of her citizenship - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: India doesn't allow its citizens to hold dual-nationality but that’s not the reason why Ms Murty is taxed as a non-domicile. This is an active choice.

claims.text: Illegal immigrants and refugees living here get an annual income of £29,900.

claimReview.title: Historic claim on refugee and pensioner incomes is still wrong - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Illegal immigrants who don’t have leave to remain in the UK can’t claim most benefits and destitute asylum seekers can only get £40.85 a week. Refugees can claim benefits but are subject to the benefits cap, which is far below £29,900 per year.

claims.text: An elderly man was told by Enfield council that his single occupier council tax discount could be removed if he didn’t house a Ukrainian family in his spare room.

claimReview.title: Single occupancy council tax discount can’t be revoked if you don’t take in Ukrainian refugees - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There’s no evidence this happened and councils can’t do this.

claims.text: The maximum state pension in the UK is £141 while in Germany it’s £507.

claimReview.title: Historic claim on refugee and pensioner incomes is still wrong - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The full state pension in the UK is between £141.85 and £185.15 a week. The German system doesn’t have a maximum, and isn’t a flat rate, but a points system dependent on earnings.

claims.text: People earning money from stocks and shares won’t pay a penny more in tax as a result of the government’s policy changes.

claimReview.title: Keir Starmer wrong to suggest taxes aren’t rising on stocks and shares - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: False. Dividend tax is increasing in line with National Insurance.

claims.text: Imperial College London’s REACT-LC study found catching Covid-19 in the colder winter months may be a factor in whether some people find their symptoms persisting.

claimReview.title: Mirror wrong to say catching Covid in warm weather cuts risk of long Covid - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not true. The Mirror compared research conducted over the 2020/21 autumn and winter period to research conducted in May 2021. These dates did not refer to when participants may have caught Covid-19 in the first place.

claims.text: The vast majority of people coming across the Channel are economic migrants, they are not asylum seekers.

claimReview.title: No evidence ‘vast majority’ of people crossing Channel in small boats are economic migrants - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There is no evidence for this. Research carried out by the Refugee Council shows the majority of nationals from the countries most represented in small boat arrivals are granted asylum. The Home Office doesn’t publish statistics covering asylum claims following small boat arrivals specifically.

claims.text: Food bank use rose by 2,612% while David Cameron was Prime Minister.

claimReview.title: 2,612% rise in food bank use under David Cameron needs context - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The number of parcels provided by the Trussell Trust network did rise by roughly this amount. This may not reflect the increase in provision by all food banks, and may not be a reliable indicator of increased need.

claims.text: A tweet from the World Economic Forum reports its founder, Klaus Schwab, as saying that as humanity moves further toward a post-carbon future people must accept things like eating meat and property ownership are simply unsustainable.

claimReview.title: WEF didn’t say that property ownership would become ‘unsustainable’ - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: No such tweet exists.

claims.text: Test and Trace ran out of money.

claimReview.title: Claims about German Test and Trace costs completely wrong - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: False. There is no evidence Test and Trace, which ran significantly under-budget in 2020/21, “ran out of money”.

claims.text: Approximately tens of thousands of people have suffered severe damage from Covid-19 vaccines.

claimReview.title: No evidence for MP’s claims ‘tens of thousands of people’ have ‘suffered severe damage’ from vaccines - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There is no evidence for this. This claim is based on Yellow Card reporting, which is not a reliable indicator of proven side effects.

claims.text: The UK spent £37 billion on Test and Trace.

claimReview.title: Claims about German Test and Trace costs completely wrong - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: False. This is the budget for NHS Test and Trace over two years, not the spend. The programme underspent by £8 billion in its first year.

claims.text: Germany spent less than £1 billion on their track and trace system.

claimReview.title: Claims about German Test and Trace costs completely wrong - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: False. We don’t know how much Germany spent in total, but the federal government’s cost of rapid tests alone far exceeds £1 billion.

claims.text: Asda’s non-organic milk is not suitable for vegetarians or Muslims because of added animal fat.

claimReview.title: Asda’s milk is vegetarian - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: False. Asda confirmed that its own-brand milk is suitable for vegetarians.

claims.text: Chris Rock has issued a statement in which he said he crossed a line at the Oscars and apologises to Will Smith and Jada Pinkett Smith.

claimReview.title: Chris Rock did not say he ‘crossed a line’ following Will Smith Oscars slap - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This statement is not real.

claims.text: VAT exemption on solar panels and heat pumps already happens in the EU, so this is not a benefit of Brexit.

claimReview.title: Chris Bryant wrong on 0% EU VAT for heat pumps - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not quite true. The EU requires member states to charge VAT on solar installations and heat pumps. However, from April, member states can choose to charge no VAT on solar panels and no less than 5% on heat pumps.

claims.text: Thanks to Brexit, the UK is no longer constrained by EU law, so homeowners having equipment such as solar panels, heat pumps and insulation installed will no longer pay 5% VAT; they will pay zero

claimReview.title: Chris Bryant wrong on 0% EU VAT for heat pumps - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: It is correct to say that within the EU, the UK would not have been able to cut VAT on heat pumps and insulation to zero, though it would now be able to on solar panels, following new EU legislation due to be introduced next month. When it was an EU member, the UK was prevented from reducing VAT on solar panels by the European Court of Justice.

claims.text: A video shows actors pretending to be victims of the Russian invasion of Ukraine in 2022.

claimReview.title: Facebook video shows actors making a TV series in 2020—not staging the war in Ukraine - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: False. The video shows actors making a Ukrainian TV series in 2020.

claims.text: Pelicans can take their spines out of their mouths to cool themselves down.

claimReview.title: Pelicans don’t push their spines out of their mouths to cool down - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: False. Pelicans don’t do this—pictures shared alongside this claim actually just show birds yawning.

claims.text: A video shows Russian soldiers unsuccessfully discharging a rocket propelled grenade launcher, because the equipment is so old.

claimReview.title: A video of a failed grenade launcher does not show Russian army - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The video appeared online before the invasion, and a longer version shows it likely features members of the Kenya Defence Forces.

claims.text: A video shows a person in a body bag in Ukraine smoking a cigarette.

claimReview.title: Video of someone smoking in a body bag was taken on set of a music video - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The clip was filmed during the production of a music video for a Russian rapper, in at least 2020.

claims.text: A picture shows Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe smiling in a selfie while her husband and daughter look despondent.

claimReview.title: Fake Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe photo makes it look like husband and daughter aren’t smiling - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The photo has been altered. In the original, all three are smiling.

claims.text: A single person on Universal Credit will receive £334 per month

claimReview.title: The House of Lords’ daily allowance is about what Universal Credit pays in a month—but peers don’t get it every day - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is currently the basic monthly allowance for a single person aged over 24. However, many claimants will receive supplementary payments, and many others will not receive the full amount if they also earn an income above a certain level from work.

claims.text: A member of the House of Lords will receive £323 per day

claimReview.title: The House of Lords’ daily allowance is about what Universal Credit pays in a month—but peers don’t get it every day - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: £323 is the allowance that members of the Lords can currently claim for each day they do parliamentary work in the House. Not all peers do claim it, however, and none claim it every day.

claims.text: A video shows Russian and Ukrainian troops dancing together, which proves the invasion is being falsely represented by the media.

claimReview.title: Video doesn’t show Russian and Ukrainian soldiers dancing together after invasion - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The video appears to predate the Russian invasion of Ukraine, and there is no proof the soldiers are from two different forces. .

claims.text: Deaths among US military personnel rose by 1,100% in 2021.

claimReview.title: US military deaths didn’t increase by 1,100% last year - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is based on inaccurate data, which has now been withdrawn.

claims.text: This is a list of criminal accusations and convictions against members of the House of Commons in 2022.

claimReview.title: List of MPs’ crimes isn’t true - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: False. The list supposedly described members of the US Congress more than 20 years ago, and even then it wasn’t verifiable.

claims.text: Ukraine just announced it's the first country to implement the WEF's Great Reset by setting up a Social Credit Application combining Universal Basic Income (UBI), a Digital Identity and a Vaccine Passport all within the Diia app.

claimReview.title: Ukraine is not enacting the ‘Great Reset’ with an app - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Ukrainians can use the Diia app to store digital ID documents, including vaccine passports and apply for a war payment if they’re eligible. But this can’t be described as a social credit application, and has nothing to do with ‘The Great Reset’—a book by the WEF’s founder about how governments respond to a post-pandemic world.

claims.text: Rishi Sunak approved £4.3 billion of Covid loans to fraudsters.

claimReview.title: Labour overstates amount spent on ‘dodgy PPE’ which will be burnt - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This appears to refer to the amount lost to fraud and error via the income support and Eat Out to Help Out schemes which HMRC does not expect to recover.

claims.text: Rishi Sunak spent £8.7 billion on “dodgy PPE so useless it will have to be burnt”.

claimReview.title: Labour overstates amount spent on ‘dodgy PPE’ which will be burnt - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: False. £8.7 billion refers to the loss in value of PPE bought in 2020/21 at the end of the financial year. While some will be burnt, DHSC said some of the equipment this loss related to was still usable—and some which wasn’t is being recycled or donated.

claims.text: Waitrose is giving away boxes of food that’s about to expire and to win you must share and comment on the post.

claimReview.title: Waitrose is not offering anyone who shares a Facebook post free food - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The page claiming this is not affiliated with Waitrose and there is no prize.

claims.text: A famous photo from the aftermath of bombing in Japan in 1945 was taken by a soldier who spotted a child carrying his dead sibling and was told “he’s not heavy, he’s my brother”.

claimReview.title: No evidence quote about photo of child in Nagasaki is true - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The picture was taken by a US Marine on assignment to photograph the aftermath of bombings in Japan in 1945, but there’s no evidence the specific interaction described actually happened.

claims.text: A newly published document lists side effects from Pfizer’s Covid-19 vaccine.

claimReview.title: A newly released document does not reveal ‘side effects’ of the Pfizer vaccine - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not true. The document lists adverse events reported after vaccination, which may not have been caused by the vaccine. It also says these adverse events raise no safety concerns.

claims.text: A picture of Putin holding a needle to a Ukraine balloon and exploding was created by the artist Banksy.

claimReview.title: Picture of Putin popping Ukraine balloon isn’t a Banksy - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: A spokesperson for the artist confirmed Banksy had nothing to do with the picture.

claims.text: A Pfizer document contains a list of around 158,000 adverse events "from their vaccine".

claimReview.title: Express publishes misleading article about safety of the Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: No it doesn’t. The document lists a mixture of reported adverse events following vaccination. Many may not have been caused by the vaccine.

claims.text: The publication of a Pfizer document in 2022 is the first time that the public have been able to view data from its clinical trials that was submitted for the Covid-19 vaccine’s approval.

claimReview.title: Express publishes misleading article about safety of the Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not true. Some clinical trial data for the vaccine’s first approval was published in December 2020. The data in this latest document is not exclusively from clinical trials.

claims.text: Fuel prices are not connected to oil prices.

claimReview.title: The price of fuel is quite closely connected to the price of oil - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Fuel prices are connected to oil prices, although other factors like tax are important. This claim is based on a misleading comparison between inflation-adjusted oil prices and non-adjusted fuel prices.

claims.text: A video shows the president and first lady of Ukraine singing a cover of Endless Love.

claimReview.title: Video doesn’t show Ukrainian president and his wife covering a Lionel Richie song - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The people in the video are not Volodymyr Zelenskyy or Olena Zelenska.

claims.text: An underground tunnel is a secret UK military site.

claimReview.title: Video of underground tunnel isn’t a secret UK military site - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The site in the video is part of a large nuclear bunker commissioned in the 1950s. It was declassified in 2004.

claims.text: News footage from Ukraine shows someone moving inside into a body bag and pretending to be a victim of the Russian invasion.

claimReview.title: Video of person moving inside body bag isn’t from Ukraine - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This clip is not from Ukraine. It has been manipulated, with the original footage being taken at a climate protest in Vienna.

claims.text: Oil is $110 a barrel and petrol can cost £1.70 per litre. In 2008 oil was $140 a barrel but petrol was only £1.04 a litre.

claimReview.title: Why is petrol more expensive now than it was 15 years ago? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The oil prices are correct as of July 2008 and early March 2022. The current petrol price figure is broadly accurate, but the figure given for 2008 is around 15p lower than the price of petrol actually was when oil reached $140 a barrel.

claims.text: The Conservatives cut the army from 98,000 personnel in 2010 to 72,500 in 2021 - a reduction of over 25,000.

claimReview.title: Labour graph showing reduction in army size is misleading - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: 72,500 represents the planned army size by 2025, not the actual army size in 2021. In 2021 at its smallest the army had 76,348 full-time trade-trained personnel—around  21,650 fewer than in 2010.

claims.text: The “hostile environment” was invented under a Labour Home Secretary.

claimReview.title: Did Labour invent the ‘hostile environment’? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Labour used the term in relation to enforcing immigration rules while in power. The Conservatives significantly expanded the scope of policies associated with the phrase.

claims.text: A photo shows a tractor in Ukraine towing a Russian rocket.

claimReview.title: Edited image falsely claims to show Ukrainian tractor pulling Russian rocket - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The image has been edited. The original from 2018 shows a Russian space rocket aboard a train.

claims.text: Publishing or sharing identifiable pictures of prisoners of war is a breach of the Geneva Convention.

claimReview.title: Is sharing photographs of prisoners of war banned by the Geneva Convention? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The relevant Geneva Convention does not explicitly ban the publication of photographs of prisoners of war. Nor does it apply to people who are not involved in the conflict. But the government and British Red Cross say that such pictures should not usually be published.

claims.text: £1 per litre of road fuel is taken in taxes.

claimReview.title: Social media posts overestimate how much tax is on petrol and diesel - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is too high in fuel duty and VAT. These account for between 80p and 90p per litre of fuel sold, depending on how much you pay for fuel.

claims.text: A black-and-white photograph of a crowded railway station looks like it could have been taken in 1941, but actually shows a scene from Ukraine in March 2022.

claimReview.title: Photograph of crowded railway station is from Ukraine in March 2022 - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct.

claims.text: A viral video claims to show US paratroopers landing in Ukraine.

claimReview.title: Viral video does not show US paratroopers landing in Ukraine - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: False. The footage reportedly shows soldiers in North Carolina and dates back to at least 2016.

claims.text: Ukrainians in the UK on a work visa can bring family members to the UK under the Ukraine Family Scheme.

claimReview.title: Sajid Javid wrong on government guidance for Ukraine family visas - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is incorrect. The current guidance doesn’t allow people to join their relatives under these circumstances.

claims.text: Footage of a plane being fired at shows the war in Ukraine.

claimReview.title: Footage of plane under fire is from a video game, not Ukraine - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is false. The footage is from a video game called Arma 3.

claims.text: In early March 2022, the government makes over £1 per litre on the petrol and diesel sales at the pump in the UK.

claimReview.title: Fuel duty and VAT adds about 80-90 pence per litre on petrol and diesel at the pump - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: It’s more like 80-90 pence per litre in fuel duty and VAT, depending on the station you buy at.

claims.text: A photograph shows a Ukrainian soldier wearing a Ghostbusters badge.

claimReview.title: Photograph of Ukrainian volunteer wearing Ghostbusters badge is genuine - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The photograph is real and shows the badge being worn by an armed forces volunteer.

claims.text: The UK Government’s Ukraine Family Scheme is the first visa scheme in the world to launch since President Putin’s invasion of Ukraine.

claimReview.title: Home Office claim to have launched first Ukrainian visa scheme lacks context - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This appears to be accurate but lacks the context that many other countries taking refugees never required visas for Ukrainians, or have waived visa requirements.

claims.text: A photograph shows the Dynamo Kyiv football team in army uniform preparing to fight in the Russia-Ukraine war.

claimReview.title: Photograph of men in military uniform doesn’t show squad members of FC Dynamo Kyiv - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The photograph doesn’t show any members of the football squad, but instead shows members of a nationalist group in Ukraine.

claims.text: The UK has sanctioned £258.8 billion of Russian bank assets, while the US has sanctioned £240 billion and the EU £38.8 billion.

claimReview.title: Government has not backed up Russian sanction claims - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The Foreign, Commonwealth & Development Office has not explained how it has calculated these figures or detailed what they represent, so they cannot be verified, and it is unclear whether they are comparable.

claims.text: Italian news channel TGCOM24 used footage from the 1998 film Deep Impact in a segment about people fleeing Kyiv.

claimReview.title: No evidence news channel used shot from Deep Impact to show people fleeing Kyiv - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There is no evidence this footage was ever broadcast by TGCOM24. There are several indicators that the post is not genuine.

claims.text: Napalm, not nuclear weapons, were dropped on Hiroshima and Nagasaki in 1945.

claimReview.title: Nuclear weapons do exist - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Evidence clearly shows the victims of those bombings suffered from injuries consistent with a nuclear attack, and not a napalm attack.

claims.text: Science fiction writer HG Wells invented the atom bomb.

claimReview.title: Nuclear weapons do exist - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: HG Wells’s writings did, in part, inspire the development of the atom bomb, but he did not invent the atom bomb.

claims.text: Nuclear weapons don’t exist.

claimReview.title: Nuclear weapons do exist - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Their long-term development, their use in 1945 on Japanese cities and the aftermath of that, and decades of research proves that nuclear weapons are real.

claims.text: The Manhattan project was a work of fantasy.

claimReview.title: Nuclear weapons do exist - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There is a vast amount of evidence that the Manhattan project was real.

claims.text: Barcodes can show if a product was made in Russia.

claimReview.title: Barcodes alone can’t show a product was made in Russia - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Barcodes can show where the company that applied for the barcode is based, but that isn’t necessarily the same as where a product was produced.

claims.text: The Defence Secretary has already secured £24 billion of additional defence funding.

claimReview.title: £24bn in extra defence spending will be spread over four years - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is the cumulative cash-terms increase in the defence budget over four years. The amount the annual budget is expected to rise by over this period is actually £6.2 billion in cash terms—and less when you take into account inflation.

claims.text: The UK has taken more vulnerable people fleeing theatres of conflict since 2015 than any other country in Europe.

claimReview.title: Boris Johnson’s claims on UK accepting people fleeing conflict miss vital context - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The figures Boris Johnson is referring to only show the numbers accepted through resettlement schemes. We don't have any reliable comparative data for the number of vulnerable people fleeing “theatres of conflict”, but figures show that other European countries have accepted far more refugees in total.

claims.text: Widely-used images of a Ukrainian woman wounded following an airstrike near Kharkiv actually depict events from 2018.

claimReview.title: Photo of wounded Ukrainian woman near Kharkiv is genuine - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is false, the photographs are genuine and were taken at the outset of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

claims.text: A video shows the devastation caused by an explosion in a Ukraine city.

claimReview.title: Video of explosion aftermath is from Lebanon in 2020, not Ukraine - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The video shows the aftermath of an accidental explosion in Lebanon in 2020 and doesn’t relate to the Russian invasion of Ukraine in February 2022.

claims.text: Ukraine’s road signs authority changed a sign to tell Russian troops to “go f*** yourselves”.

claimReview.title: Sign telling Russian troops ‘go f*** yourselves’ was Photoshopped - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The Ukrainian road signs authority did post a picture of this sign, but it is not genuine. Rather, it was Photoshopped as part of a post encouraging Ukrainians to dismantle road signs.

claims.text: A video shows recent Russian attacks on Ukraine.

claimReview.title: Lightning strike video doesn’t show war in Ukraine - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The video appeared online in January 2022, so is not from the invasion of Ukraine which started on 24 February.

claims.text: A map shows the potential sites of Russian nuclear strikes on the UK.

claimReview.title: Map of Russian nuclear targets in UK dates back to the Cold War - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The locations were suggested by the UK government in documents made 50 years ago, during the Cold War, and don’t give any reliable indication of the situation today.

claims.text: A video of a plane being shot at shows the fighting in Ukraine.

claimReview.title: Video shows game footage, not a plane being shot at in Ukraine - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is footage from a video game, as confirmed by the game’s developers.

claims.text: A video filmed on a street shows a massive explosion in Ukraine.

claimReview.title: Beirut port explosion footage being mistaken as Ukraine - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The video was taken in 2020, and appears to show the port explosion in Beirut.

claims.text: Shaking your duvet, climate change, energy drinks, shovelling snow and your electric bill can all reportedly cause heart attacks in 2022.

claimReview.title: Collection of heart attack articles includes one fake - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The article claiming shaking your duvet can risk heart attacks is fake. The one about climate change is from 2010. The one about energy drinks does not prove energy drinks cause heart attacks. The last two are based on claims made by doctors.

claims.text: Pornhub was blocked for users in Russia following the invasion of Ukraine.

claimReview.title: Pornhub isn’t blocked in Russia following the invasion of Ukraine - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This was a rumour that appears to be untrue. Pornhub worked normally when other fact checkers used software to simulate a visit from Russia.

claims.text: CNN reported the death of the same man twice, in both Afghanistan and Ukraine.

claimReview.title: CNN did not claim the same man was killed in both Ukraine and Afghanistan - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not true. It is based on screenshots of fake CNN Twitter accounts. The photo used appears to be of a YouTuber, who is alive.

claims.text: Images show a young Ukrainian girl telling a Russian soldier to go home.

claimReview.title: Images of girl confronting soldier are not from Ukraine - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: False. The images come from a video that was published in 2012. It says it shows Palestinian children.

claims.text: A video shows Ukraine international airport being blown up.

claimReview.title: Video shows explosion at air base, not Ukraine’s main airport - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The video in question shows an explosion at an air base in Melitopol in Ukraine, which appears to be a military base rather than an international airport serving civilians.

claims.text: A video of military planes is recent footage from the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

claimReview.title: BBC Breakfast uses old footage of Russian parade rehearsal to show invasion of Ukraine - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The footage is actually from May 2020, and shows preparations for a military parade near Moscow.

claims.text: A video of an air raid shows Russia invading Ukraine.

claimReview.title: CGI WW2 video being used as Ukraine footage - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The video is a CGI animation of WW2 and was put online long before the 2022 invasion.

claims.text: Rates of Covid-19 infection were lower in England than in Scotland or Wales in January 2022.

claimReview.title: Maajid Nawaz got Covid-19 facts wrong on the Joe Rogan podcast - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not true. Rates in England were higher than in Scotland or Wales.

claims.text: Around 17,000 people have died of Covid-19 in Britain.

claimReview.title: Maajid Nawaz got Covid-19 facts wrong on the Joe Rogan podcast - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not true. By late January 2022, more than 142,000 deaths due to Covid-19 had been registered in England and Wales alone.

claims.text: Covid-19 vaccines do not protect 5-year-olds or 12-year-olds against serious illness or death with the disease.

claimReview.title: Maajid Nawaz got Covid-19 facts wrong on the Joe Rogan podcast - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not true. Covid-19 vaccines do substantially protect against the small risk of serious illness and death in children.

claims.text: Sajid Javid said that Covid-19 deaths in the UK had been overestimated.

claimReview.title: Maajid Nawaz got Covid-19 facts wrong on the Joe Rogan podcast - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is misleading without context. Mr Javid said that one measure of Covid-19 deaths had begun to overestimate the total since the Omicron variant arrived in the UK. However, this does not affect the more accurate measure of the death toll during the pandemic, which is based on death certificates.

claims.text: Three photographs show explosions in Ukraine.

claimReview.title: Photos claiming to show explosions in Ukraine are actually from Gaza - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: One of the photographs is of an explosion in Ukraine. The other two show Gaza.

claims.text: A video shows a fire started by a Russian airstrike.

claimReview.title: Video of 2015 explosion in China being mislabelled as Ukraine - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The video shows an explosion at a warehouse in China in 2015.

claims.text: Videos on social media claim to show the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

claimReview.title: Videos claiming to show Ukraine invasion sourced to old TikTok videos - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Some of these videos clearly do not depict the Russian invasion of Ukraine as they predate the invasion.

claims.text: A video of military planes flying overhead is footage from the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

claimReview.title: Video claiming to show planes during Russian invasion of Ukraine is actually of 2020 parade rehearsal - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: False. It shows footage of a military parade rehearsal from May 2020.

claims.text: Videos show Ukraine being invaded by Russia.

claimReview.title: Fake Ukraine video includes footage from 2015 and a computer game teaser - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: At least some of the videos do not show this.

claims.text: There are 430,000 more people in employment than before the pandemic began.

claimReview.title: Boris Johnson repeats misleading claim on number of people in employment - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: False. The number of payrolled employees is up 436,000 but the total number in employment (including the self-employed)  is down 588,000.

claims.text: This police car’s MOT certificate is overdue.

claimReview.title: Police cars are exempt from having an MOT - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: That’s what the government’s checking service says. It also says that police cars are exempt from the MOT.

claims.text: Raw data from a recent Vaccine Surveillance report from the UKHSA shows a sharp drop in vaccine effectiveness against infection in most age groups

claimReview.title: Estimating vaccine effectiveness by comparing case rates is seriously flawed - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is based on comparing Covid-19 case rates between vaccinated and unvaccinated individuals which is inappropriate.

claims.text: Keir Starmer has voted 48 times to take the UK back into the European Union.

claimReview.title: Keir Starmer hasn’t voted 48 times to take the UK back into the EU - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not correct. The figure appears to be based on how Mr Starmer voted in 48 votes related to Brexit. But some of these votes were not about whether Britain should be part of the EU, and all but three took place before Britain left the EU. Mr Starmer has often opposed the Government in Brexit votes, but has also voted a number of times in support of Brexit.

claims.text: A 0.05% financial transactions tax would raise £250 billion which could pay for a 15% pay rise for NHS workers until 2049.

claimReview.title: Viral tweet on wealth tax generating £250 billion for NHS is misleading - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The £250 billion such a tax is estimated to raise is a global tax, and so would not be spent on the NHS alone.

claims.text: MPs can claim £50 for the cost of a breakfast.

claimReview.title: MPs can’t claim £50 for a breakfast - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: No, they can’t. The maximum daily food and drink allowance for MPs is £25.

claims.text: A video shows a rolling ferry during Storm Eunice in February 2022.

claimReview.title: Footage of a rolling ferry was not made during Storm Eunice - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Incorrect. It shows a ferry during Storm Dennis in February 2020.

claims.text: Sir Anthony Hopkins is the author of a short essay on personal relationships.

claimReview.title: No evidence Sir Anthony Hopkins penned essay about personal relationships - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There is no evidence for this. Similar words predating the first instance of the essay being attributed to Sir Anthony have been attributed to another author.

claims.text: A news reporter gets hit by a sign while reporting during a storm.

claimReview.title: Irish reporter did not get hit by sign during storm - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Although most of the video is genuine, the part where she gets hit by the sign was edited in.

claims.text: Queen Elizabeth II is being treated for Covid-19 with ivermectin.

claimReview.title: News clip doesn’t prove Queen is being treated with ivermectin - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There is no evidence to suggest this is true. The news channel, which accidentally broadcast a shot of ivermectin during a segment about the Queen’s treatment, has apologised and said it was the result of “human error”.

claims.text: A video shows Storm Eunice blowing a wheelie bin, a trampoline and chairs around in the air.

claimReview.title: Flying bin video was not filmed during Storm Eunice - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The video was taken in 2021, during a suspected tornado in Barking, London.

claims.text: Iceland’s CEO is offering anyone who shares or comments on a Facebook post a box of essential goods worth £40.

claimReview.title: Iceland’s CEO is not offering free food to people who like a Facebook page - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is false. Iceland has said the post has nothing to do with them.

claims.text: NHS Test and Trace spent £37 billion on an app.

claimReview.title: Test and Trace money wasn’t just spent on an app - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: NHS Test and Trace was allocated £37 billion for the first two years of operation, but expects to spend about £28 billion. The tracing app accounted for less than 1% of this spend, most of which went on testing.

claims.text: Data from the US military shows a sharp rise in the incidence of various diseases in 2021.

claimReview.title: US defence data showing rise in diseases in 2021 was produced in error - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The data supporting this claim is flawed, and has been withdrawn by officials.

claims.text: 550,000 more pensioners were in debt in Great Britain in 2020, compared with 2010.

claimReview.title: More older people have financial debt—but fewer are actually struggling - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: It’s true that about 550,000 more people aged 65 or over had some kind of non-mortgage debt by the end of the 2010s, but the number who found that debt to be a problem actually fell over the same period.

claims.text: A video shows Storm Eunice had arrived early in Portsmouth.

claimReview.title: 'Storm Eunice video' supposedly showing crane fall in Portsmouth is actually from Poland - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The video was taken in Poland during a different storm.

claims.text: You are not meant to have unprotected sex after a second dose of the Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine as it could cause birth defects due to genetic manipulation.

claimReview.title: Pfizer’s Covid-19 vaccine does not cause birth defects - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not advice for everyone who’s had the Pfizer vaccine. There is no evidence the vaccine causes birth defects. This was a precaution in the vaccine trial, as is standard in many trials, to prevent participants conceiving shortly afterwards, but there was no suspicion of a link with birth defects.

claims.text: At least 50% of people who survive Covid-19 have debilitating health issues in the months afterwards.

claimReview.title: Washington Post overstates prevalence of long Covid - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is far too high. There are various estimates for the prevalence of long Covid. The Office for National Statistics estimated that 7.5% of people infected with Covid-19 self-reported having long Covid three  months after infection which limited their  daily activities.

claims.text: If you drive during Storm Eunice your car insurance will be voided.

claimReview.title: Driving during red weather warning won’t void your insurance - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: False. Driving during bad weather does not void car insurance, though driving negligently may affect any compensation or payout you receive should you need to make a claim.

claims.text: Female-titled storms and hurricanes are more deadly.

claimReview.title: Storms with female names are not ‘more deadly’ because people underestimate them - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not true. It comes from a research paper that was subsequently shown to be flawed.

claims.text: People vaccinated against Covid-19 may be experiencing a form of vaccine-induced acquired immunodeficiency syndrome.
