claimReview.textualRating: This study shows that there was a link between a moderate intake of tea and coffee a reduced risk of certain types of stroke and dementia. However, the study did not show that tea and coffee intake was definitely the cause. It also found that very high tea and coffee intake was linked with a higher risk than drinking none.

claims.text: Theresa May should drop her deal, extend the implementation period to the end of 2021 if necessary; use it to negotiate a free trade deal; pay the fee; but come out of the EU now—without the backstop.

claimReview.title: You can’t have an “implementation period” after Brexit without a deal - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The implementation period is part of Mrs May’s deal—in order to leave the EU imminently and still have an implementation period the UK would need to pass that deal.

claims.text: We’re seeing the largest sustained drop in NHS funding as a percentage of GDP since the founding of the NHS.

claimReview.title: NHS video, factchecked - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct. The King’s Fund has found that between 2010 and 2020 UK NHS spending will see the largest ever sustained reduction as a percentage of GDP.

claims.text: University applications fall by 25,000 as effects of Brexit and funding changes hit.

claimReview.title: Have university applicant numbers fallen in 2017? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Applicant numbers have fallen by this much, compared to last year’s UCAS June deadline. There are probably a few things driving this, but UCAS says a major factor is a fall in the number of 18 year olds in the UK population. The 18 year old application rate is still at a record high.

claims.text: Judge Jonathan Durham Hall refused to jail a 15 year-old girl that stabbed a paedophile with a kitchen knife who had been abusing her since she was eight. The charge was grievous bodily harm with intent. He fined the girl then offered to pay the fine for her.

claimReview.title: A judge did say he would pay a teenage girl’s victim surcharge after she stabbed the man who had sexually assaulted her - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Mostly correct. The girl stabbed a man who had sexually assaulted her when she was eight. The judge did give her a two year youth rehabilitation order, but told her that he would pay the victim surcharge himself if she was ordered to.

claims.text: Boris Johnson said that wages are rising which is a lie.

claimReview.title: Angela Rayner wrong on wage growth - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Boris Johnson said this in relation to wages over the past year, which are up in real terms.

claims.text: A document on the UK government website says the third wave of deaths will come from the vaccine.

claimReview.title: The government hasn’t said the vaccine will cause a third wave of deaths - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Modelling suggests that when a third wave occurs, hospitalisations and deaths will mostly be in those who’ve been vaccinated. This is because so many vulnerable people will have been vaccinated by then, not because the vaccine is harming them.

claims.text: Funding for the NHS has increased significantly in recent years.

claimReview.title: State spending isn’t at a record high when you consider the size of the economy - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct, as it has done throughout almost its entire history.

claims.text: Hydroxychloroquine and zinc have been used all over the world to cure Covid-19.

claimReview.title: Luminescent enzymes not in Covid-19 vaccine and other myths debunked - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: They haven’t. Studies looking at hydroxychloroquine alone or in combination with zinc show no effect either as a treatment or as a preventative measure.

claims.text: Most of our trade with the world is based on WTO rules.

claimReview.title: Does most UK trade happen outside of the EU and trade agreements? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Most of our trade (57% of exports and 66% of imports in 2016) is with countries we have EU trade agreements with, not under WTO rules. But trade agreement tariffs on some goods and services are the same as those we have with other countries.

claims.text: 40% of people in Glasgow live below the poverty line.

claimReview.title: Is 40% of Glasgow living in poverty? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: We haven’t found this specific figure. We do know that 48% of areas in Glasgow were among the 20% most deprived in Scotland in 2016. That’s not the same as 48% of people though.

claims.text: An annotated map shows how many churches have been destroyed in France over the last four years.

claimReview.title: This map doesn’t just show churches “destroyed” in France - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The map is not just of “destroyed” churches; it shows many types of incident including vandalism, fires, violence, and theft that has occurred in or around churches, as well as attacks on priests, and other incidents the maps’ creators deem as religiously motivated.

claims.text: Options for post-Brexit trade deals with the EU will lead to between 2% and 8% lower GDP.

claimReview.title: This viral image showing the cost of different Brexit deals is wrong in a lot of ways - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is based on government analysis of 3 hypothetical deals, which explicitly can’t be used as economic forecasts and are very uncertain. According to the analysis GDP will continue to grow over the next fifteen years in each case, but more slowly than on existing OBR projections.

claims.text: Coronavirus rates among teachers are 333% above the average.

claimReview.title: We don’t know whether teachers are more likely to catch Covid - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This claim comes from incomparable data. We don’t know whether teachers are more likely to catch Covid or not.

claims.text: The government is building 40 new hospitals over the next decade.

claimReview.title: The government has given six hospitals money to upgrade buildings - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Six hospitals in England have been given the money to upgrade their buildings within the next five years. Up to 38 hospitals are being given money to develop plans for their hospitals between 2025 and 2030, but not to actually begin any building work.

claims.text: We have had fourteen times the number of people in hospital with Covid than we saw this time last year.

claimReview.title: Covid-19 hospitalisations are below last year, not 14 times higher as NHS CEO claimed - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: False. The number of people with Covid in hospital in November 2020 was above, not below, the level in November 2021.

claims.text: The BBC used old footage of Boris Johnson laying a Remembrance wreath.

claimReview.title: The BBC did use old footage of Boris Johnson laying a Remembrance Wreath - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct, in 2019 it twice used footage from the 2016 Remembrance Sunday service.

claims.text: You should just ignore a parking charge notice.

claimReview.title: This advice on how to fight a parking ticket is wrong - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: You shouldn’t ignore it completely. If you want to appeal the notice then don’t pay immediately and follow guidance on appeals provided by Citizens Advice. But if you don’t have grounds to appeal, then it’s best to pay.

claims.text: The super-rich and big corporations dodge £90 billion in tax every year.

claimReview.title: Comparing tax dodging and benefits for people seeking asylum - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is an unofficial estimate of the total tax gap. The figures are disputed and do not just cover tax dodging by the super-rich and big corporations.

claims.text: The UK missed its interim renewable energy target.

claimReview.title: Are we missing our targets on renewable energy? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The UK's target was for 5.4% of its energy consumption to come from renewable sources over 2013 and 2014. Provisional calculations show it met this target.

claims.text: New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern has ordered all MPs to take a 20% pay cut during Covid-19 crisis.

claimReview.title: Not all New Zealand MPs have been ordered to take a pay cut, and UK MPs have not awarded themselves a £10,000 bonus - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Ms Ardern has given herself, government ministers and public service chief executives a 20% pay cut. This does not cover all MPs.

claims.text: Everyone has thousands of viruses inside their body.

claimReview.title: Almost all of these claims about viruses are wrong - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is true, although that doesn’t mean that Covid-19 is harmless.

claims.text: The deaths of 181 NHS workers have involved Covid-19.

claimReview.title: We don’t know exactly how many NHS workers have died from Covid-19 - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This figure is correct for England only.

claims.text: The government will build 40 new hospitals.

claimReview.title: Boris Johnson’s first interview of 2020: fact checked - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Six hospitals in England are getting the money to upgrade their buildings within the next five years. Up to 38 hospitals are getting money to develop plans for their hospitals between 2025 and 2030, but not to actually begin any building work.

claims.text: London is now one of the world’s most violent capital cities.

claimReview.title: Islam in London: factchecking the viral image - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: At least six other capital cities have far higher homicide rates.

claims.text: 260,000 over-75s have refused to pay their licence fee.

claimReview.title: Facebook post makes incorrect claims about TV licence fee non-payment - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is the number of over-75s who are yet to make payment arrangements for their TV licence after the government ended its subsidy. There is no evidence that all 260,000 are refusing to pay.

claims.text: The UK is a world leader in robberies.

claimReview.title: Robbery: Is the UK a “world leader”? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The increase in the number and rate of recorded robberies between 2015 and 2016 was greater in England and Wales than in any of 12 other countries examined in Home Office analysis. But in Spain, the USA and France the actual number and rate of robberies was higher than in England and Wales.

claims.text: Nearly a quarter of all researchers and a quarter of all clinicians at Great Ormond Street hospital are from other EU countries.

claimReview.title: EU staff at Great Ormond Street hospital - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: 23% of doctors and 17% of all doctors and nurses at Great Ormond Street reported they were from the EU in 2015. We’re still trying to track down the figures on researchers.

claims.text: Britons have spent £4bn stockpiling goods in case of no-deal Brexit.

claimReview.title: £4 billion Brexit stockpiling claim based on flawed survey - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is almost certainly an exaggeration. The survey it’s based on likely overestimates the amount that has been stockpiled, and consumer spending data shows no evidence of people stockpiling to this degree.

claims.text: Headline vote intention figures from a poll of North East Somerset residents have the Lib Dems at 28%, in second place behind the Conservatives on 44%. Labour were third on 14%.

claimReview.title: You need to read the small print on this Lib Dem voting intention graph - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct.

claims.text: The government has brought in legislation that allows DNA from Covid-19 tests to be “harvested” and retained.

claimReview.title: There’s no connection between new biometrics legislation and Covid-19 tests - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is incorrect. This legislation allows the police to retain DNA profiles obtained related to national security and has nothing to do with Covid-19 testing.

claims.text: Covid-19 has a survival rate of 99.8%.

claimReview.title: Covid-19 survival rate is less than 99.8% - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The survival rate varies by country but this estimate is too high for the UK. Estimates of the survival rate range from around 99% to 99.5%.

claims.text: The wife of the CEO of Pfizer has died of complications from the Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine.

claimReview.title: The wife of the Pfizer CEO did not die from its vaccine - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not true. She is alive and well.

claims.text: The UK has a trade deficit with the EU.

claimReview.title: About 1 in 7 German cars are sold in the UK - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: That’s true overall. We have a trade surplus in services, and a much larger trade deficit in goods.

claims.text: There's no evidence of a big drop-off rate of apprenticeships.

claimReview.title: How many apprenticeships are successfully completed? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: While the number of apprenticeships achieved each year has remained consistent, looking at achievements as a proportion of those finishing or due to finish shows,  just under a third were unsuccessful - a proportion which has been increasing.

claims.text: Theresa May has been claiming between £400 and £520 per month for ‘cleaning’ at her home.

claimReview.title: Parliamentary expenses: is this meme about Theresa May correct? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: These sums were claimed back in April-October 2006 and July 2006 to March 2007. They covered the whole period rather than being monthly.

claims.text: Restricting in-work benefits to EU migrants would make a huge difference to EU migration.

claimReview.title: Would restricting in-work benefits to EU migrants reduce immigration? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is far from certain. There is no direct evidence that welfare is a prime pull factor for a significant number of EU migrants coming to the UK.

claims.text: A million people accessed a food bank last year and only 40,000 did so in 2010.

claimReview.title: Food banks: hard to say whether rising use reflects rising demand - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: A million food packs were given out by the Trussell Trust last year, and 40,000 in 2010. One million people using all food banks in the country is plausible, but we don’t have complete figures.

claims.text: Average UK house prices rose roughly fourfold between 1990 and 2020.

claimReview.title: House price growth has outstripped income growth—but not by much - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is true,  in cash terms.

claims.text: 76% think the Government are negotiating Brexit badly.

claimReview.title: These poll figures are for leave voters - not "most of the nation" - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: That's of adults in Great Britain voting 'Leave' in the 2016 referendum, according to one survey. Among all adults in Great Britain, it's 75%.

claims.text: Cafes, bars, restaurants and shops are closed.

claimReview.title: Viral list of UK lockdown rules is not right - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Cafes and restaurants can still provide takeaway services, and some shops remain open. Bars are closed.

claims.text: A study found the risk of a group of patients having a heart attack within five years increased from 11% to 25% after they were given their mRNA Covid-19 vaccine.

claimReview.title: Concerns raised about legitimacy of research linking vaccines and heart attacks - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Serious concerns have been raised as to the quality of the research. Its publisher notes it may contain “potential errors”.

claims.text: A Facebook post defending the government’s role in current NHS equipment shortages was written by Jennifer Saunders.

claimReview.title: No, Jennifer Saunders did not write this statement about PPE shortages - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: No, this post was not written by Jennifer Saunders.

claims.text: No country had a functioning contact-tracing app in June 2020.

claimReview.title: Was Dawn Butler right about Boris Johnson ‘lying’ to Parliament? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Several countries had operational contact-tracing apps that had been downloaded millions of times. In June 2020, it wasn’t clear how effective any of them were in reducing the spread of Covid-19.

claims.text: Obesity kills 30,000 people a year, or 82 a day.

claimReview.title: Covid-19 has killed more people than obesity in the UK this year - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This was an estimate made by Public Health England in 2017.

claims.text: Part of the reason the UK is experiencing such high gas prices right now is because of Brexit, and the UK leaving the Internal Energy Market.

claimReview.title: Has Brexit caused higher gas prices? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There is not evidence that this is a significant factor in higher wholesale gas prices in the UK at the moment.

claims.text: Between 2014-15 and 2016-17, killings where either the victim or suspect were involved in using or dealing illegal drugs increased from 50% to 57%.

claimReview.title: Drugs and homicide - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is based on homicides in England and Wales where it’s possible to say whether the victim and/or suspect was a drug user or dealer. As a proportion of all homicides, the increase is from 41% to 42%. We also don’t know the levels for any other years.

claims.text: This means in the UK the Covid-19 survival rate for 0-59 year olds is 99.991%.

claimReview.title: Covid-19 survival rate is not 99.991% for under 60s - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: It doesn’t mean this. The data used only talks about England, and we can’t know for sure how many 0-59 year olds in England have had and recovered from Covid-19.

claims.text: Covid-19 tests detect any coronavirus, not just the one that causes Covid-19.

claimReview.title: A Covid-19 diagnostic test won’t pick up other coronaviruses - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Incorrect. Covid-19 diagnostic tests are not perfect, but they won’t misdiagnose other coronaviruses as the virus which causes Covid-19.

claims.text: 54% would be unhappy if the Chequers deal was carried through.

claimReview.title: These poll figures are for leave voters - not "most of the nation" - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: That's of adults in Great Britain voting 'Leave' in the 2016 referendum, according to one survey. Among all adults in Great Britain, it's 43%.

claims.text: Pretty Little Thing’s terms and conditions state that its products may contain chemicals that can cause cancer, birth defects or other reproductive harm.

claimReview.title: Pretty Little Thing products can contain lead, but probably not dangerous amounts - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is true, it says they may contain lead. The amounts contained are probably not dangerous though.

claims.text: BBC Radio 2 DJ gets paid over £1.3 million a year but pensioners have to pay for the TV licence.

claimReview.title: Some pensioners still receive a free TV licence - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is how much Zoe Ball got paid to present her Radio 2 breakfast show in 2019/20. Pensioners under 75 have to pay the TV license. People over 75 do not have to pay for a TV licence if either they or a partner they live with receive Pension Credit, which could be as many as 1.5 million households.

claims.text: Vaccine manufacturers have never claimed their vaccines stop transmission of Covid-19.

claimReview.title: David Icke makes false claim that vaccines are ‘gene therapy’ - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not true and there’s plenty of evidence to show how the vaccines do considerably reduce transmission.

claims.text: 100,000 retail jobs have been lost in three years.

claimReview.title: Have 100,000 retail jobs been lost over three years? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There were 98,000 fewer jobs in retail in Great Britain in June 2018 than in June 2015, a drop of around 4%. These figures don’t count self-employed jobs or those in online retail.

claims.text: The majority of British Jews are Zionists.

claimReview.title: Are the majority of British Jews Zionists? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: A 2015 survey found about 3 in 5 British Jews identify as Zionists, though the term isn’t clearly defined. 9 in 10 British Jews support the right of Israel to exist as a Jewish state.

claims.text: The number of people unhappy with the NHS is at the highest level for 30 years.

claimReview.title: The level of dissatisfaction with the NHS is not the highest on record - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The rise in dissatisfaction with the NHS over the past year is the largest annual increase in 30 years. The level of dissatisfaction is now roughly where it was between 2011 and 2013. It has previously been much higher.

claims.text: Suicides have increased 200% under lockdown.

claimReview.title: There is no evidence that suicides have increased 200% under lockdown - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There is currently no evidence for this. It is unclear where this figure has come from.

claims.text: The estimated cost of Brexit is £4.15 per person per day.

claimReview.title: This viral post about the costs of Brexit gets a lot of things wrong - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This seems to be based on an estimate of how much lower UK GDP could be in 2030, compared to if we remained in the EU. This is a hypothetical model for comparing possible paths: it cannot be used to accurately predict the size of the economy in 2030, or to translate the “cost" of Brexit into a definitive cash sum.

claims.text: The increase in reported hate crimes after the EU referendum was due to the way the crimes were perceived and reported, not the number of hate crimes actually being committed.

claimReview.title: Hate crime and the EU referendum - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: An increased tendency to report hate crime may explain part of the recent surge in hate crimes recorded by the police. It’s a matter of judgement how much.

claims.text: The government's Brexit white paper said that UK workers were going to get 14 weeks holiday.

claimReview.title: Are we all getting 14 weeks holiday? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: A chart in the paper comparing UK and EU holiday entitlement said that under UK law workers get 14 weeks holiday and under EU law workers get 5.6 weeks of paid maternity leave. It’s actually the other way round. The government has now corrected the chart.

claims.text: A million people attended the anti-lockdown march in London on 24 April 2021.

claimReview.title: There were nowhere near one million people at the anti-lockdown march - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is implausible based on video footage of the march.

claims.text: 8.4 million people are watching S4C every week in the UK.

claimReview.title: The hunt for 8.4 million Welsh-speaking telly addicts - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: S4C's annual report actually says 578,000.

claims.text: Rail companies have held average fare increases below inflation.

claimReview.title: Rail fares are increasing in price faster than other goods and services - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Rail companies have held price increases slightly below the RPI measure of inflation, but this isn’t considered reliable. Better measures of inflation suggest the fare increases are higher than inflation.

claims.text: In 1983, US children got 10 vaccines and the autism rate was 1 in 10,000.

claimReview.title: Autism prevalence is up but scientists have consistently found that vaccines don’t cause it - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: We don’t know exactly how prevalent autism was in 1983. There were around five vaccines involving 11 doses recommended for children in the US back then.

claims.text: Ticketmaster is planning a mandatory Covid-19 vaccine verification policy for concert attendance.

claimReview.title: Ticketmaster won’t demand proof of a Covid-19 vaccine for concert entry - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Ticketmaster said it is exploring a number of safety features that events organisers may want to use, including checks on test and vaccine status, but entry requirements will be up to organisers.

claims.text: The NHS operates on the wrong part of someone’s body four times a day.

claimReview.title: Jeremy Hunt muddled the numbers on botched surgeries - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Incorrect. In the English NHS surgeons operate on the wrong part of someone’s body four times a week, according to figures from April to November 2019.

claims.text: Glutaraldehyde is in vaccines and is poisonous if ingested and causes birth defects in animals.

claimReview.title: This image about vaccine ingredients is extremely misleading - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There are trace amounts in some vaccines from manufacturing, and not enough to cause harm.

claims.text: Snapchat knows what time you were born even if you don’t put those details in the app.

claimReview.title: Snapchat doesn’t secretly learn the time you were born - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Birthday, time of birth and place of birth are all entered manually by the user to access certain in-app features.

claims.text: If you have a runny nose and sputum, you have a common cold, not Covid-19.

claimReview.title: Viral post about someone’s uncle’s coronavirus advice is not all it’s cracked up to be - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: These are the symptoms for the common cold, but they don’t rule out Covid-19.

claimReview.title: List of symptoms and how to prevent the new coronavirus contains inaccuracies - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: These are the symptoms for the common cold, but they don’t rule out Covid-19.

claims.text: Official government reports suggest the fully vaccinated will develop AIDS by the end of the year.

claimReview.title: Covid-19 vaccines don’t cause ‘a form of AIDS’ - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: It doesn’t. There are problems with both the underlying data used to come to this conclusion and the analysis of it.

claims.text: There are four million 17 year-olds that turn 18 before the November election.

claimReview.title: This image claiming there are four million 17 year-olds who’ll be able to vote in the election is not about the UK - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Incorrect—there are only around 725,000 17 year-olds in the UK. The general election is set to be on 12 December.

claims.text: The average age of Covid-19 deaths is higher than the average life expectancy, which means that people who get Covid live longer.
claims.claimant: Alleged messages from Boris Johnson reported by BBC

claimReview.title: Average Covid-19 victim dies years before they otherwise would - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This isn’t how life expectancy works. Life expectancy is an average, pulled down by people who die young. As you age, your life expectancy increases. People dying from Covid-19 lose about a decade of life on average.

claims.text: There are another 431,000 foreign born workers in the UK.

claimReview.title: Reports on employment figures are accurate, but not the whole picture - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: That’s correct. The ONS’ best estimate for the number of non-UK born workers rose by 431,000 between the end of 2015 and the end of 2016.

claims.text: A video shows a robbery at knife point in London.

claimReview.title: This video of a robbery at knife point did not take place in London - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The video is actually from South Africa.

claims.text: The UK is making progress towards meeting its 2020 targets on renewable energy.

claimReview.title: Is the UK making progress towards its 2020 renewables target? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: It has met its interim targets, but that doesn’t mean it will meet the target for 2020. Without further action from the government the target will be missed.

claims.text: Youth unemployment is down 44% since 2010.

claimReview.title: How the jobs market for young people has changed since 2010 - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct.

claims.text: Use of public transport is only about 5% of its usual numbers.

claimReview.title: Public transport use higher than transport minister claimed - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not correct. When Mr Shapps said this, passenger levels on National Rail, London Underground and non-London buses had all been above this level for several weeks.

claims.text: Health tourism costs £200 million a year—or the cost of running the NHS for 15 hours.

claimReview.title: NHS video, factchecked - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct, though this is based on rough estimates for 2012/13.

claims.text: A hundred-thousand pupils have failed to return to school full time despite classrooms reopening in March 2021.

claimReview.title: Pandemic school attendance: fact checked - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The Centre for Social Justice, found 93,514 pupils missed more than 50% of school sessions between September to December 2020 so this is unrelated to the reopening of schools in March. Before the pandemic the figure was about 60,000.

claims.text: Pets carry no threat and do not carry the new coronavirus.

claimReview.title: There’s still no evidence that you can catch the new coronavirus from your pet - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is correct. At present, there’s no evidence that dogs and cats can be infected.

claims.text: If all the other lockdowns haven’t worked, why would this one be any different?

claimReview.title: Viral influencer video full of false Covid-19 claims - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: False. The government estimates locking down in the spring saved thousands of lives compared with doing nothing.

claims.text: Record levels of working class students are leaving university before completing their degree.

claimReview.title: Are more working class students dropping out of university? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The proportion of young UK students from disadvantaged areas dropping out of higher education in England by their second year is at its highest level for five years, but it’s not a record high. That’s looking at full-time students on their first degree, and is based on educational disadvantage. Disadvantaged students, including working class students, are generally more likely to drop out than advantaged.

claims.text: Satellite images showing high levels of sulphur dioxide above China are possible evidence of mass cremations of people who have died from coronavirus.

claimReview.title: These aren’t satellite images and they don’t show evidence of mass cremations in Wuhan - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: False. The maps are not satellite images, and do not show actual levels of sulphur dioxide. They are simply forecasts based on historical data and weather patterns.

claims.text: Only 4% of non-EU goods get checked by the UK and only one per cent by Ireland.

claimReview.title: Irish border: how much trade? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct for the UK. The best evidence we’ve seen for Ireland is that it was 6% in 2016.

claims.text: A new EU withdrawal bill allows the EU to choose the length of a further Brexit extension and the UK has no say in it.

claimReview.title: A new Brexit bill doesn’t allow the EU to unilaterally extend the Brexit date - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Incorrect. If the EU suggests an extended exit date other than 31 January 2020, the government can ask parliament whether or not it approves of that proposal, and parliament can choose to reject it.

claims.text: There have been 2 million apprenticeships created over the past six years, with more planned.

claimReview.title: Apprenticeship funding: going up or down? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There have been 2.5 million apprenticeships started since 2010. The government aims to create 3 million apprenticeships by 2020.

claims.text: There have been £6 billion of cuts to social care in the last eight years.

claimReview.title: Social care: what’s the situation? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is the estimated cumulative difference between what councils in England wanted to spend and what they had the available budget to spend on adult social care between 2010 and 2017. The expected savings this year are planned to take the figure to £7 billion. We’ve asked the Association of Directors of Adult Social Services for more information about the figure.

claims.text: The deficit in trade with the EU has narrowed by £4.4 billion to £3.2 billion.

claimReview.title: April’s trade figures fact checked - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The trade deficit with the whole world, not just the EU, fell to £3.2 billion in the three months to April 2021.

claims.text: Face masks are useless at stopping Covid-19 because the gaps in them are larger than a Covid-19 viral particle.

claimReview.title: The holes in face masks don’t mean they’re useless - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Face masks, especially surgical masks, have been shown to reduce Covid-19 infection.

claims.text: Lorraine Kelly said photos from India showed the improvement in air quality driven by the lockdown, with the Himalayas visible in a photo taken after lockdown compared to one taken before.

claimReview.title: Viewers spot Lorraine Kelly Himalayas gaffe - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating:
The “before” photo is just an edited version of the “after” photo, illustrating what the skyline might have looked like before lockdown.

There is evidence the lockdown in India improved air quality and visibility to the point where the Himalayas were visible from Jalandhar.

claims.text: Britain sends 50% of exports to the EU and only 8% to the 'BRICS' economies (Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa).

claimReview.title: Ask Full Fact: the UK’s trade with the EU - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: 44% of exports—of both goods and services—went to EU countries in 2014, and 8% to the BRICS. 50% to the EU would have been right a few years ago.

claims.text: There were fewer deaths recorded in the first 15 weeks of 2020 than in the first 15 weeks of 2018.

claimReview.title: Total deaths in the UK in 2020 have now risen above the deaths during the same period in 2018 - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct, although the number of deaths in recent weeks far exceeds the number at the same point in any recent year.

claims.text: Locking down in the early stages of the virus is linked to a reduced excess death toll.

claimReview.title: The limits of what we can say about early lockdowns - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This may be true, but showing a correlation between the number of excess deaths and the time of lockdown is not enough evidence to argue this point, as the FT did.

claims.text: The government spent £60 billion on HS2.

claimReview.title: How much of this meme on government spending is true? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Almost—it was predicted to be £56 billion in total in 2015. The cost to date has probably been around £4.1 billion.

claims.text: Covid-19 is a rebrand of flu

claimReview.title: Covid-19 is not a rebrand of flu - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Covid-19 is not a rebrand of flu. Although there has been a reduction of flu this year there is no evidence to suggest that Covid-19 is simply influenza in a new guise. Not least because they are caused by different organisms.

claims.text: A majority of 6,200 doctors said hydroxychloroquine is the most effective coronavirus treatment.

claimReview.title: No, a survey didn’t find a majority of doctors saying that hydroxychloroquine is the most effective treatment for Covid-19 - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The poll the data comes from is not representative of all doctors. 37%, not a majority, of those involved in Covid-19 treatment worldwide said hydroxychloroquine was among the most effective treatments.

claims.text: Youth unemployment is down by over 40%.

claimReview.title: Is youth unemployment down 40%? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct. The number of unemployed 16-24 year olds has fallen by 43% between 2010 and 2018.

claims.text: Every five minutes 60 people migrate to the UK.

claimReview.title: One born every minute? How many migrants arrive in the UK and how many children do they have? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Incorrect. The equivalent of around five and a half people migrated to the UK every five minutes in the year to September 2017. Net migration was around two every five minutes.

claims.text: The government spent £44,000 on a toilet for Jeremy Hunt.

claimReview.title: How much of this meme on government spending is true? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Jeremy Hunt said that a newly fitted bathroom in the Department of Health building was for long distance cyclists, rather than his personal use. The government hasn’t confirmed how much it cost.

claims.text: The MHRA has confirmed deaths due to Covid-19 vaccines in 10 months are 330% higher than deaths due to all other vaccines in the past 20 years.

claimReview.title: Covid vaccines have not caused four times as many deaths as all other vaccines combined - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The MHRA did not say this. These statistics are based on reports sent to the regulator’s Yellow Card scheme, which does not confirm whether someone died from a vaccine. The MHRA also says deaths after Covid vaccines cannot be reliably compared with deaths after other vaccines, as there may be differences in reporting.

claims.text: A court decision gives employers the right to check all the messages an employee sends from company computers.

claimReview.title: Can the boss now read your messages at work? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The decision was that privacy rights don't rule out employers checking whether staff are sending personal messages on work computers, in particular circumstances. It doesn't directly change UK law, which already allows some monitoring.

claims.text: The flu vaccine doesn’t work because the flu has not been eliminated.

claimReview.title: It's incorrect to say flu vaccines don't work - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Incorrect. The flu vaccine prevents illness and deaths. However, it can only protect against some of the ever-changing viruses that cause the flu.

claims.text: A photo shows hundreds of dead birds killed by 5G signals.

claimReview.title: Dead birds in India were not killed by 5G - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not true. The photo is at least five years old, predating 5G.

claims.text: Research finds short term breaks from school are harmful to pupil attainment.

claimReview.title: Research doesn't prove short breaks from school cause poorer pupil attainment - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The research doesn't prove that holidays cause poorer attainment, only that pupils with higher rates of absence overall perform less well.

claims.text: Italy has found that Covid-19 is actually disseminated intravascular coagulation (thrombosis).

claimReview.title: Facebook post about Italy, coronavirus and 5G is almost all false - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This disease has been observed in Covid-19 patients but it’s not correct that patients have that and not Covid-19.

claims.text: Labour was winning in the polls over the last year.

claimReview.title: Polls didn't show a consistent Labour lead - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is incorrect. Three isolated polls since the last general election have shown Labour ahead. Each time that has happened, most polls showed the Conservatives ahead. Individual polls aren’t enough evidence to see if one party is leading.

claims.text: There is no VAT paid on Jaffa Cakes, razors, and pitta bread, unlike tampons.

claimReview.title: Tampons, Jaffa Cakes, and razors: we pay no VAT on some of these items - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Jaffa Cakes and shop-bought pitta bread are zero-rated, but VAT on razor blades is at the standard 20% rate. VAT on tampons is at a reduced rate of 5%, the minimum it can be under current EU rules.

claims.text: The coronavirus vaccines have been produced too quickly to be safe.

claimReview.title: Social media video makes false claims about Covid-19 - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: False. The vaccines in use have all passed multiple stages of animal and human trials and been shown to be safe and effective.

claims.text: The same photo shows Jeremy Corbyn wearing an ‘I heart the IRA’ t-Shirt.

claimReview.title: Jeremy Corbyn did not attend an IRA funeral wearing an ‘I heart the IRA’ t-shirt - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The photo of Jeremy Corbyn has been edited.

claims.text: The vaccines won’t stop me spreading Covid-19.

claimReview.title: Inaccurate Covid vaccine ‘Q&A’: fact checked - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Research shows Covid-19 vaccination does lead to lower levels of transmission.

claims.text: The UK will cease to recognise and allow the import of mineral water from the EU and EEA from January 2022.

claimReview.title: Claims of an EU mineral water ban need a drop of context - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is missing context. Manufacturers of EU mineral water can continue to export it to Britain as long as they renew their accreditation by 7 January 2022.

claims.text: The OECD says that jobs and earnings in the UK are good.

claimReview.title: UK economy; what was the OECD's verdict? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct.

claims.text: The number of people being taken to police cells under mental health legislation has more than halved.

claimReview.title: Fewer police cells are being used to hold people with mental health problems - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct. This continues a falling trend over several years.

claims.text: A no deal Brexit will cost us nothing.

claimReview.title: Claims that a no deal Brexit “will cost us nothing” are incorrect - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Incorrect. The government has already spent money on specifically preparing for no deal. Experts say no deal may lead to a long-term reduction in economic prosperity.

claims.text: 37% of coronavirus deaths in Germany are in care facilities.

claimReview.title: It’s not true that 58% of Covid-19 deaths in Scotland were in care homes - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct up to May.This was reported by the ECDC.

claims.text: All major parties, and the Scottish National Party, have been fined for mistakes made on national election expenses.

claimReview.title: Has the SNP ever been fined for election spending mistakes? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Incorrect. The Conservatives, Labour, and the Liberal Democrats have all been fined by the Electoral Commission. The Electoral Commission told us it has never issued the Scottish National Party with any kind of fine or sanction.

claims.text: EU rules mean we cannot take VAT off energy bills.
claims.claimant: Michael Gove, Boris Johnson and Gisela Stuart

claimReview.title: What could happen to VAT and energy prices if we leave the EU? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: That’s right. EU rules mean we cannot reduce VAT on household energy any lower than the 5% that’s currently charged. All EU member countries would have to agree any changes to these rules.

claims.text: Airlines in Spain and Russia have warned people vaccinated against Covid-19 not to fly.

claimReview.title: Vaccinated people are not warned against flying - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not true. There is no evidence of any airline saying this.

claims.text: Event 201 was run by the Johns Hopkins University in cahoots with the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation.

claimReview.title: US rapper Pitbull wrong to claim Event 201 was ‘rehearsal’ for coronavirus pandemic - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: It was run by the Johns Hopkins Center for Health Security in partnership with the World Economic Forum and the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation.

claims.text: A poll shows that 80% of British people want to quit the EU.

claimReview.title: Factcheck: Daily Express EU "poll" is biased and wide of the mark - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This "ballot" says nothing about the state of nationwide opinion. Recent professional polls show that around 36% to 48% of people support leaving.

claims.text: Mathematical modellers claimed tens of millions of people were going to die from Covid-19.

claimReview.title: Trafalgar Square “Freedom Rally” speech littered with false claims - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Untrue. A report by Imperial College presented to the government suggested that 510,000 people in the UK could die if nothing was done in response to the disease.

claims.text: NHS staff at the top of band 5 earned £27,534 a year in 2010 and £30,112 a year in 2020.

claimReview.title: Pay for some nurses has fallen in real terms since 2010 - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct. These are the salaries of NHS staff at the top of band 5 in England in 2010/11 and 2019/20.

claims.text: Covid-19 has been found to cause blood clotting.

claimReview.title: Claims about Russia, Covid-19 and 5G are almost all false - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: It is true that abnormal blood clotting has been observed in some Covid-19 patients, but this is not the only potential serious outcome of the disease.

claims.text: The Brexit deal has passed Parliament.

claimReview.title: The Brexit deal has not passed Parliament - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: It has not.

claims.text: In Britain, you’re allowed to wave terrorist flags.

claimReview.title: You almost certainly won’t get arrested for flying a British flag - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There are laws preventing the display of terrorist flags, but the police have been known to not arrest people for this.

claims.text: Scientists in Israel are likely to announce the development of a coronavirus vaccine.

claimReview.title: Good news coronavirus list needs context - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Scientists in Israel and elsewhere are working on developing a vaccination to prevent the spread of the new coronavirus, but it won’t be ready for the public for over a year.

claims.text: The government has produced a lot of information about the extent of vaccine damage including the Yellow Card scheme.

claimReview.title: MP makes unevidenced claims about vaccine damage - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: It is misleading to equate Yellow Card reports with “vaccine damage”. The MHRA is very clear that reports of adverse events after vaccination cannot be treated as confirmed side effects, as there is no proven causal link.

claims.text: If we leave the EU with no deal, the divorce bill is no longer strictly speaking owed.

claimReview.title: Does a no deal Brexit mean no divorce bill? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: It’s not clearly set out that the UK would be obliged to pay anything if we left with no deal, but the EU could take the case to the International Court of Justice on the grounds of the UK’s repeated commitments to pay.

claims.text: People with disabilities are set to see a real-terms cut of £1.2 billion a year across this parliament.

claimReview.title: Is spending on disability benefits going up or down? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Spending on all disability, incapacity, industrial injuries and carer’s benefits, including related housing benefit, is expected to fall by £1.2 billion by the end of this parliament. Spending won’t fall by this amount every year—it will fall by £295 million each year on average.

claims.text: The average pensioner household is now better off than the average working household.

claimReview.title: Are pensioners better off than people of working age? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: That’s correct, once you account for housing costs, according to research done by the Resolution Foundation think tank. The Institute for Fiscal Studies also found in 2015 that the median income among pensioners, after housing costs, was 5% ahead of the typical non-pensioner. It’s not the case before housing costs.

claims.text: Dog food bought in B&M and made in China has led to two dogs being put down in the last two weeks because it destroys their kidneys.

claimReview.title: Are dogs dying from eating jerky treats? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: We have seen no specific evidence of this. There is evidence of a link between dogs eating jerky treats and developing a kidney disorder, but this is not linked to treats from one specific brand or shop. Many of the cases involve jerky made in China.

claims.text: The same nurse was pictured vaccinating the first two recipients of the Covid-19 vaccine in the UK, despite them being 20 miles apart.

claimReview.title: False claims about first vaccine recipients spread on social media - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The first two patients were not 20 miles apart. They were at the same hospital in Coventry.

claims.text: 108 people died from Covid-19 in China on February 10th, one of the worst days so far.

claimReview.title: It’s true these things kill more people each day than Covid-19 has so far - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: It is true that 108 people died in China from Covid-19 on 10 February, however, this death toll has since been surpassed.

claims.text: The UK’s biggest export market is Germany.

claimReview.title: Trading places: Who are the UK and Germany’s biggest trade partners? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Incorrect. The USA is the UK’s biggest export market. We exported almost £100 billion of goods and services to the USA in 2016. Germany is our second biggest export market at around £49 billion.

claims.text: The government has put 12 billion more into the NHS than in 2010 under Labour. The government has also promised another 6 billion for the NHS.

claimReview.title: How much money does the NHS need and how much is it actually getting? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Spending on NHS England increased by £12.7 billion between 2009/10 and 2017/18, taking inflation into account. The government has said it will spend an additional £6.3 billion up to 2022/23, though that’s in cash terms.

claims.text: No longer sending money to the EU means we will have money to spend on priorities like the NHS.

claimReview.title: NHS England: £394 million more a week? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There is no guaranteed extra money to pay for increased NHS funding from stopping our payments to the EU budget. Other costs associated with Brexit are expected to outweigh the savings.

claims.text: Asymptomatic carriers of Covid do not spread disease.

claimReview.title: Video shares falsehoods about face masks and asymptomatic spread of Covid-19 - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This isn’t true. As the pandemic has gone on, it has become clear that asymptomatic transmission can occur.

claims.text: 57% of Clinical Commissing Groups plan to reduce their spending on mental health services

claimReview.title: Spending on mental health services - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct, as best we know. 57% of Clinical Commissioning Groups that responded to an FOI request said they planned to reduce their spending this year. 128 out of 211 CCGS had responded to the request when this statistic was published.

claims.text: Tomatoes, raspberries, blackberries and lemons produce positive lateral flow test results for Covid-19.

claimReview.title: Acidic foods don’t test positive for Covid - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: These foods break the lateral flow devices creating a fake “positive” result. This doesn’t tell us anything about whether the tests are reliable when used correctly.

claims.text: There have been no tests to assess the safety of combining or overlapping Covid-19 and flu vaccines.

claimReview.title: Trafalgar Square “Freedom Rally” speech littered with false claims - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There have been a number of studies. Research suggests they’re safe and effective. Further work into their combination is ongoing.

claims.text: In 2010, a newly qualified teacher’s salary was £21,500 and in 2018 was £22,000.

claimReview.title: This tweet on public sector pay doesn’t factor in inflation - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This doesn’t factor in inflation. In 2018 prices, a new teacher’s salary in a local authority-run school in England and Wales and outside of London was £25,400 in 2010 and £22,900 in 2018.

claims.text: There are more GPs in the NHS today than in 2015.

claimReview.title: GP numbers: up or down? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct looking at the headcount of GPs (excluding locums) in England between September 2015 and 2018. Looking at the full-time equivalent number of this group, which gives a better idea of staffing levels, the numbers are falling.

claims.text: What the government has labelled the Omicron variant is actually cases of the common cold.

claimReview.title: Funeral director’s viral claims about vaccinated people not based in fact - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The Omicron variant of the virus has been sequenced, and over 45,000 cases of it have been confirmed in the UK so far.

claims.text: Most countries in the EU require that your passport is valid for six months on the date of return from your holiday.

claimReview.title: Why the government recommends having 6 months left on passports to visit Europe - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The EU says that your passport must be valid for three months the day after you return from your holiday.

claims.text: The National Living Wage will cost care homes an extra £1 billion a year by 2020.

claimReview.title: Pay for carers: will the 'national living wage' increase spending by £1 billion a year? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Some of this cost could be incurred anyway without the new policy, and the figure rests on a lot of uncertainty. Other estimates even suggest higher costs.

claims.text: 65% of assessed child refugees coming to the UK were actually adults.

claimReview.title: How many child asylum seekers are found to be adults? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct, but most child asylum seekers are not challenged about their age.

claims.text: Men in Uxbridge and South Ruislip live 14 years longer than they do in Stockton North.

claimReview.title: Alex Cunningham and Boris Johnson both used the wrong figures about health inequality - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Men in one very deprived ward of Stockton have an average life expectancy of 64. Most men in Stockton North have a much longer life expectancy, however. The figure for Uxbridge and South Ruislip is for the London borough of Hillingdon as a whole, which is 80.

claims.text: Young people are about twice as likely to suffer from “long Covid” after a coronavirus infection

claimReview.title: Matt Hancock got the evidence about long Covid wrong - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is incorrect, based on the data Mr Hancock mentioned, which suggests that people over 70 have about twice the risk of people under 50.

claims.text: Pakistani men are disproportionately involved in grooming gangs.

claimReview.title: What do we know about the ethnicity of people involved in sexual offences against children? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Some studies have found that a disproportionate number of offenders and suspected offenders in child grooming gangs are categorised as being of Asian ethnicity and most don’t break this down any further so we can’t know if they are Pakistani. But all of the studies stress that the data isn’t good enough to know whether this is a true reflection of offenders in these cases.

claims.text: Dominic Cummings’ sister, Alice Cummings, is director of Idox group, which runs the new NHS track and trace and trace app and was involved in the UK’s postal voting system.

claimReview.title: Dominic Cummings’ sister is not director of company that runs the NHS track and trace app - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The Alice Cummings who is director at Idox is not his sister. The company Idox has been involved with postal voting, but has nothing to do with the NHS’ track and trace app.

claims.text: If people stopped getting tested, the government wouldn’t see the number of cases, and we wouldn’t have more lockdowns.

claimReview.title: People deciding not to get tested will not make it look as though coronavirus has been wiped out - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The number of positive cases isn’t the only measure used to understand the spread of the virus. The number of tests and things like test positivity are also used. A lack of testing might lead to an extended pandemic.

claims.text: A network of Canadian scientists are making excellent progress in Covid-19 research.

claimReview.title: Good news coronavirus list needs context - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: At least one group of Canadian scientists has recently announced some progress in understanding Covid-19.

claims.text: 58% of people in the UK would be comfortable with a female head of state.

claimReview.title: How does the UK feel about women leading the country? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: A recent survey found 58% of UK adults aged 18-64 would be “very comfortable” with a female head of government, and a further 30% were “fairly comfortable”.

claims.text: The Astrazeneca vaccine in the UK causes blood clots.

claimReview.title: Unevidenced claims about the AstraZeneca vaccine on social media - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The AstraZeneca Covid-19 vaccine is not associated with an increased overall risk of blood clotting disorders. There have been a small number of cases of a rare type of blood clot following vaccination. It is not clear whether this is linked to the vaccine or not, and this is being closely monitored by regulatory bodies.

claims.text: The UK dropping our EU treaty commitment to "ever closer union" would make us less likely to be drawn into a federal Europe.

claimReview.title: Renegotiating "ever closer union" - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Unlike opt-outs in specific areas of EU activity, this change wouldn't have a direct legal effect. Any impact would be mainly political.

claims.text: Charles Bronson attacked Ian Huntley in prison.

claimReview.title: Charles Bronson has not attacked Ian Huntley in prison - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is incorrect. Ian Huntley and Charles Bronson are in separate prisons and there are no reports of any similar attack.

claims.text: The government is putting 20,000 more police on the streets.

claimReview.title: Boris Johnson’s first interview of 2020: fact checked - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The government has committed to do this. If this happens it will take the number of police in England and Wales to almost, but not quite the same level as it was at in 2010.

claims.text: Tens of thousands of workers will share in a £1.8 billion pay rise under a US trade deal.

claimReview.title: The government’s “£1.8 billion pay rise” from a US trade deal doesn’t outweigh the impacts of Brexit on wages - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Government analysis shows wages could be 0.2% (£1.8 billion) higher after 15 years under a scenario where we sign a free trade deal with the USA compared to a baseline scenario where we don’t. But this baseline assumes wages will be 6.4% lower than they would have been, had we remained in the EU.

claims.text: There are 6,000 fewer nurses and 400 fewer doctors working in mental health under this government.

claimReview.title: Fewer doctors and nurses working in mental health - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There were 6,100 fewer nurses in 2015 compared to 2010 in England, using a broad definition of mental health nurses that includes learning disability nurses. Looking only at mental health nurses there were 4,600 fewer over the same time. There were 170 fewer fully trained doctors specialising in psychiatry and psychotherapy in 2016 compared to 2010.

claims.text: 200,000 attended the parade.

claimReview.title: The 1918 Philadelphia parade fact checked - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This was reported as the attendance at the time.

claims.text: In Wales you can exercise near your home more than once a day if you wish but only with members of your household.

claimReview.title: It’s true that recent changes to lockdown rules are slightly different throughout the UK - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is correct as of 11 May.

claims.text: London is losing 3,000 police officers from the streets.

claimReview.title: Is London losing 3,000 police officers? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is the Metropolitan Police’s working assumption for how many officers will be lost between now and 2020.

claims.text: Dettol antiseptic spray says it kills human coronavirus.

claimReview.title: The makers of Dettol did not know about the new Wuhan coronavirus before the rest of us - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: That is correct but that doesn’t mean that Dettol spray can kill the new coronavirus identified in Wuhan. Coronavirus is a category of viruses that includes the common cold, and it is likely this the label is referring to.

claims.text: MSG is in vaccines and is linked to birth defects, developmental delays, infertility and is banned in Europe.

claimReview.title: This image about vaccine ingredients is extremely misleading - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: It’s not banned in Europe. It’s used in some vaccines to stabilise them. There’s no strong evidence it causes these problems in humans.

claims.text: The starting salary for police officers has not increased from its level in 2010, when it was £23,000.

claimReview.title: MPs salaries have grown faster than starting salaries of nurses, teachers and police officers - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This figure is wrong. In 2010, a newly qualified constable’s starting salary was £23,000; it is now £24,200. However, if you factor in inflation this amounts to a 14% fall in pay.

claims.text: Boris Johnson has never said fears about inflation were “unfounded”.

claimReview.title: Boris Johnson did say inflation fears had been ‘unfounded’ - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not true. Interview footage shows the Prime Minister saying this in October 2021.

claims.text: An image shows litter left by Extinction Rebellion environmental protestors in Hyde Park.

claimReview.title: This picture does not show the aftermath of the Extinction Rebellion protests - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The litter was actually left following an event in Hyde Park promoting cannabis use.

claims.text: Six million people earn below the living wage.

claimReview.title: Are six million people earning less than the living wage? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Around six million jobs pay less than the living wage as calculated by the Living Wage Foundation. That's not quite the same as six million people because some people have more than one job.

claims.text: Solar installations are down 94%.

claimReview.title: Labour makes misleading claim on solar energy - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating:
This is misleading, because it compares two especially extreme months (March and April 2019), which almost always see a major drop in new solar capacity. 

Overall, the amount of new solar capacity being generated has stagnated significantly since 2017.

claims.text: Every year for the past 10 years, 500,000 people who weren’t born in the UK and haven’t paid taxes signed up with a UK GP.

claimReview.title: Claim that 500,000 people who haven’t paid any UK tax sign up with GPs per year is wrong - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: About 650,000 people a year, of whom most are probably immigrants, sign up with GPs in England and Wales. They have all almost certainly contributed to public services like the NHS by paying taxes though.

claims.text: There was an £8 billion increase in revenues from additional rate taxpayers after the top rate of tax was reduced from 50p to 45p.

claimReview.title: Did cutting the 50p rate of tax raise £8 billion? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Revenues did increase by that much, but tax receipts were artificially low in 2012/13 and artificially high in 2013/14 due to people ‘deferring’ income from one tax year to another in order to benefit from the lower tax rate. So this can’t be described as the amount of money raised by the reduction in the rate.

claims.text: NHS Test and Trace changed its packaging between December 2020 and February 2021 to hide the presence of ethylene oxide.

claimReview.title: Chemical used to sterilise Covid-19 tests won’t turn into deadly antifreeze - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: While the packaging did change this was done to clarify that only testing swabs were sterilised with ethylene oxide. This is still clearly stated on other packaging included with the tests.

claims.text: Labour built 61,000 homes for social rent in Scotland.

claimReview.title: The state of social renting in Scotland - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Incorrect. 37,000 new-build social homes were started under eight years of Labour-Lib Dem coalition government in Scotland.

claims.text: It’s against the law to travel with an unrestrained pet in your car.

claimReview.title: Driving with an unsecured pet isn’t an offence, but driving carelessly is - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: It’s not against the law to drive with your pet unsecured, but if the animal distracts you or you have an accident then this could be an offence.

claims.text: Antibiotics should be used to fight Covid-19.

claimReview.title: This post about Covid-19 and blood clotting conditions contains inaccuracies - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Antibiotics are not recommended in patients with Covid-19. Covid-19 is caused by a virus and antibiotics are used to prevent or treat bacterial infections.

claims.text: A relentless workload is forcing teachers to leave the profession for lower paid jobs.

claimReview.title: Is a relentless workload forcing teachers to leave for lower paid jobs? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Research found people leaving teaching roles in state schools are ending up in jobs which are on average lower paid, at least in their first year. It's not clear to what extent workload pressures are encouraging teachers to leave for lower paid jobs specifically.

claims.text: We should never do any testing of asymptomatic people. All we’re doing is generating false positives.

claimReview.title: Conservative Woman article falsely claims vaccines don’t work - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: False. Testing people who don’t have symptoms uncovers many people who have asymptomatic and presymptomatic Covid-19. The false positive rate of Covid-19 tests is very low.

claims.text: This picture shows trucks carrying dead bodies of Covid-19 victims and the accompanying post implies it is in Italy.

claimReview.title: These trucks aren’t carrying the bodies of Covid-19 victims, and the picture wasn’t taken in Italy - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This picture was taken in Paris and the trucks are not carrying dead bodies. However, Italy has had to use military trucks to move bodies during the crisis.

claims.text: Tesla cars have been bought to transport COP26 delegates and because there aren’t enough charging points, they will be charged via a diesel run generator.

claimReview.title: World leaders will not get Tesla cars at COP26 - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Supplied electric vehicles for the climate change conference will be Jaguar Land Rover vehicles and any generators will run on recycled cooking oil.

claims.text: Each side of protective surgical masks has different functions, indicated by colour, and you should choose the way you wear by whether you are ill or not.

claimReview.title: You should generally wear a protective face mask with the coloured side pointing outwards - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is incorrect. Generally, if they have a coloured side, you should wear your mask with this pointing outward—but always read the manufacturer’s instructions to be sure.

claims.text: 200,000 elderly are abused by partners.

claimReview.title: Over 200,000 elderly people experienced domestic abuse in 2017/18 - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating:
Around 210,000 people aged 60 to 74 in England and Wales are estimated to have been victims of domestic abuse in 2017/18. 

Of those people, 152,000 were victims of domestic abuse by a partner. 

However, the data is likely to underestimate the true extent of domestic abuse.

claims.text: A million children have been gang raped and groomed in the UK.

claimReview.title: Many children have been the victims of grooming gangs, but there’s no evidence for a figure of one million - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This figure is not reliable. It appears to come from assuming that the number of suspected cases of child sexual exploitation in 2018/19 can be multiplied by 30 years—which still does not reach one million. We don’t know what the true number is.

claims.text: Research in England involving giving children the Covid-19 vaccine has been stopped due to cases of Sudden Infant Death Syndrome in those children.

claimReview.title: Covid-19 child vaccine trial paused over clot concerns, not cot death - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: A trial in children aged 6-17 has paused new vaccinations as a precaution, but no child involved died. It’s been paused subject to discussions between researchers at MHRA about the possible link between the AstraZeneca vaccine and very rare blood clots in adults.

claims.text: 97% of positive PCR tests for the Covid-19 virus are false.

claimReview.title: 97% of PCR positives aren’t false - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Theoretically, this could happen at a time of extremely low prevalence, but is not true overall.

claims.text: A poll found 77% of Labour Party members think recent calls of antisemitism in the party are to discredit Jeremy Corbyn and discredit criticisms of Israel.

claimReview.title: What did Labour Party members say about antisemitism? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct, but 66% think that antisemitism in the Labour Party is a genuine problem.

claims.text: 1 million people bid for 85,000 apprenticeship places last year.

claimReview.title: Apprenticeships cause confusion in the headlines - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The figures are incomplete and only cover part of the year. They also only show applications not applicants.

claims.text: Young British people would be conscripted into an EU army under EU regulations.

claimReview.title: The UK can’t be forced into an “EU Army” - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The EU has no formal plans for an EU army, or for military conscription. The UK has a veto on EU military policy so couldn’t be forced to participate in an EU army.

claims.text: The UK can test nearly 250,000 people a day for Covid-19.

claimReview.title: Lots of people are getting confused over testing figures - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is probably not true, because it would rely on testing everybody just once, which does not happen in practice.

claims.text: A photo shows a Palestinian girl after her house was demolished in 2003.

claimReview.title: Facebook post claiming to show Palestinian girl who grew up to be a lecturer not what it seems - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This photo was taken in Gaza and shows a young girl, but was taken in 2014, not 2003.

claims.text: Tony and Cherie Blair are directors at a company involved in the PFI that funded Norfolk and Norwich University Hospital, which continues to receive rent from the NHS for use of the hospital.

claimReview.title: Tony and Cherie Blair are not directors of a PFI consortium - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The hospital was built using a PFI. The Blairs are not and have never been directors of Octagon Healthcare, the company responsible for the PFI.

claims.text: Russian President Vladimir Putin has ordered Russia’s population to stay at home for 15 days or face five years in jail.

claimReview.title: Vladimir Putin did not say that all Russian people should stay at home or face five years in jail - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: People in Russia arriving from high-risk areas must quarantine themselves for 14 days, and could face jail if they do not, but the general population has not yet been ordered to stay at home.

claims.text: Youth unemployment is lower than many comparable economies.

claimReview.title: Is youth unemployment at a historic low? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Youth unemployment in the UK is lower than the OECD average. The UK has the 9th lowest rate out of G20 countries, and 4th out of countries in the G7.

claims.text: The UK spends less as a percentage of GDP on the NHS than France or Germany.

claimReview.title: UK health spending compared to France and Germany - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is correct.

claims.text: Daily deaths from cancer in England were in 450 in October.

claimReview.title: A comparison of daily deaths from Covid-19 and non-Covid causes is incorrect - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This seems to be an average based on 2015-2017 figures. Looking at 2019 figures 378 people died per day on average.

claims.text: Celine Dion reacted to a fan singing ‘I Surrender’ to her by winding up her window.

claimReview.title: No, Celine Dion didn’t wind her car window up while a fan was singing to her - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This video is edited. In the original Celine Dion listens to the singer.

claims.text: There is no route at all for you to get rid of Ursula von der Leyen.

claimReview.title: Was the new President of the European Commission democratically elected? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The President of the European Commission’s office ends after five years, when new EU elections take place. The President also has to be approved by elected MEPs, who can also vote them out of office with a censure motion.

claims.text: Local authorities are proposing 459,000 homes for Green Belt land, up from 425,000 a year ago.

claimReview.title: Are there plans to build on the Green Belt? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is uncertain but plausible. That’s according to the Campaign to Protect Rural England’s analysis of English council plans—typically plans for building over the next 15 years. The figures are rough estimates.

claims.text: Covid-19 trial participants who received the placebo will be considered as vaccinated.

claimReview.title: Placebo recipients are treated as vaccinated for 16 weeks once trials end - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is true, as the government has said it wants to ensure people who take part in the trials are not disadvantaged. In many cases, including the Novavax trial, participants who initially received the placebo will later be offered a vaccine. After the trial, participants have 16 weeks to get an NHS standard vaccine if they have not already received an appropriate one in their trial.

claims.text: Albert Einstein warned in 1949 the time would come when the rich would control the means of communication, making it impossible for ordinary people to make informed decisions.

claimReview.title: Albert Einstein did argue the rich control the means of communication and this damages democracy - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Einstein wrote that this had already happened in 1949.

claims.text: Boris Johnson said he wishes he’d been born in the middle ages when he could behead peasants and have sex with a “stable boy”.

claimReview.title: No evidence Boris Johnson said he wanted to “lop the heads off of smelly peasants” - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There is no evidence Boris Johnson said this. There is no record or archive of this quote beyond non-attributable Facebook and Twitter posts.

claims.text: The government gave the police much more use of Tasers to help deal with street crime.

claimReview.title: Boris Johnson’s first interview of 2020: fact checked - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The Home Office announced police in England and Wales can bid for part of a fund to equip their force with more Tasers. Final funding allocations will be announced in February.

claims.text: The UK bought all the Midazolam France had.

claimReview.title: Influencer video full of untrue vaccine claims - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is false. The Department of Health and Social Care has confirmed that all of the Midazolam stockpiled in the UK for the Covid-19 crisis was sourced within the UK and was produced for the UK market. It appears that this claim is based on reports of some French-label versions of the drug being stockpiled for use in the UK.

claims.text: Covid-19 vaccines have not been tested and there are no medical studies underlying them.

claimReview.title: False claims from funeral director about facemasks, vaccines and the pandemic - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The Covid-19 vaccine trials have been published in peer-reviewed journals. The data collection and analysis are ongoing, in order to allow up to two years of follow up on participants.

claims.text: Top chief executives earn in 2.5 days what an average worker earns in a year.

claimReview.title: Top CEOs make average worker salary in three days - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: In the right ballpark. In 2018 the average FTSE 100 CEO earned in around three days what a full-time worker does in a year on average.

claims.text: Experts agree that jobs would be lost

claimReview.title: EU Referendum Voting Guide: Stronger In on jobs - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The latest minutes from the Monetary Policy Committee at the Bank of England do warn that some jobs might be lost, at least in the short term. This is in line with what other economists have said about the impact on the economy of leaving the EU.

claims.text: Children are more likely to produce more harmful spike proteins after they’ve been vaccinated.

claimReview.title: Critical report on BBC Newsround story is misleading - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The theory that spike proteins produced by Covid-19 vaccines are harmful is unevidenced.

claims.text: Adult education has been cut by 35% during David Cameron’s time as Prime Minister.

claimReview.title: Adult skills funding: what happened in the last Parliament? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Analysis by membership body the Association of Colleges has shown that spending on core adult skills for those aged 19 and over fell by 35% between 2009/10 and 2015/16. The cut was about 41% once inflation is accounted for.

claims.text: The new Nightingale Hospital in London wants people to post it home-made art to brighten up the walls.

claimReview.title: NHS Nightingale does not want art in the post - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not true. The “Rainbows for Nightingale” appeal was not an official one. The hospital has confirmed this.
