claimReview.title: Brexit and household incomes - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Incorrect.

claims.text: The Spanish government hasn’t said that it would veto an independent Scotland joining the European Union.

claimReview.title: EU membership: Spain vs Scotland - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct, although it has said that Scotland would have to leave the EU and re-apply from the outside.

claims.text: A Scottish Water worker was overheard saying there’s radium in the water in Scotland and it’s making people ill but they’re not meant to be telling people.

claimReview.title: Scottish Water says there’s no radium in its drinking water - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Scotland’s water supplier says there is no radium in its drinking water.

claims.text: A picture shows mushrooms growing out of the hand of a dead raccoon.

claimReview.title: Fungi growing ‘out of’ dead possum’s hand is staged - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The photo is staged, and shows a type of fungi (which does commonly grow around decaying corpses) which has been placed in the paw of a dead possum.

claims.text: The UK's welfare system, public services and lax border controls explain the presence of migrants at Calais trying to cross.

claimReview.title: Why are there so many migrants at Calais? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Benefits aren't available to illegal immigrants, although asylum seekers get some support and use of public services. It's hard to say how secure the border is.

claims.text: Unemployment in the West Midlands Combined Authority has risen by 25% in a year.

claimReview.title: MP’s claim about rising unemployment in the West Midlands is wrong - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Incorrect. The unemployment rate in the area decreased from 6.7% to 5.9% between 2017/18 and 2018/19.

claims.text: Men may be taken to court and face serious sentences if they whistle at a woman and she calls the police, if proposals to count misogyny as a hate crime go ahead.

claimReview.title: Is wolf whistling about to become illegal? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Even if rules do change on categorising hate crimes, wolf whistling in isolation would likely be classified as a hate incident, rather than crime, as it is not illegal. So wolf whistling alone is unlikely to result in prosecution.

claims.text: Death certificates with codes from the first chapter of ICD 10 show deaths that were caused by infectious disease.

claimReview.title: The infectious diseases in an ONS graph are not the ones you might expect - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The first chapter of ICD 10 does not include all infectious diseases. It also includes some diseases, such as sepsis, that are not contagious.

claims.text: Costs to the average family have risen by almost £6,000 since 2010.

claimReview.title: Labour claims about savings under their policies are not credible - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This figure is exaggerated and does not represent what an average family has had to pay.

claims.text: Unemployment under Labour rose.

claimReview.title: Unemployment under Labour - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct. The UK unemployment rate and total number of people unemployed was higher when Labour left government than when it entered it. That said, unemployment was relatively low for much of the party’s term.

claims.text: Pupils on free school meals do far worse in GCSEs in selective Kent compared to non-selective London.

claimReview.title: Poor children do worse in areas that have grammar schools - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct, although London is well ahead of the rest of England as well.

claims.text: Ofcom has rules that the Green Party can't take part in the televised leaders' debates.

claimReview.title: Factcheck: Did Ofcom say the Greens can't take part in leaders' TV debates? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: It's not the regulator's call, but keeping the Greens off the list of 'major parties' means broadcasters are legally entitled to leave them out of the debates.

claims.text: You need to be 18 to buy a house.

claimReview.title: What rights do you get at 18? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct for England and Wales, though you can have one owned in trust by a trustee.

claims.text: Illegal immigrants and refugees living in Britain get a weekly hardship allowance of £100.

claimReview.title: Viral image about pensioners and refugees is wrong on every single number - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Incorrect. This allowance does not exist.

claims.text: Future governments are required to run a budget surplus when the economy is doing well.

claimReview.title: Paying off the debt, one law at a time - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: These kinds of rules can always be repealed by a future government, and they can be broken without any particular legal consequences.

claims.text: 1.4 million women every single year suffer from domestic violence.

claimReview.title: Sexual violence and domestic abuse - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: We can't know exactly. An estimated 1.4 million women aged 16-59 were victims of domestic abuse in 2013/14 in England and Wales. There were an estimated 1.3 million victims in 2015/16, and 430,000 cases involved violence.

claims.text: There were 46,850 self-harm incidents in prisons in the year to March 2018, up 16%, and an average of 128 recorded a day.

claimReview.title: Violence and drugs in prison - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct.

claims.text: The number of young offenders has fallen to a record low.

claimReview.title: Young people and race in the criminal justice system - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: That’s correct for England and Wales.

claims.text: As a percentage of GDP, government spending on the NHS is set to fall.

claimReview.title: UK health spending compared to France and Germany - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is correct, assuming government spending plans happen and the UK’s output of goods and services (GDP) increases as predicted. The proportion of GDP made up by NHS spending is set to decrease to April 2021.

claims.text: There were 14 deaths in children aged 12 to 17 who had the Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine.

claimReview.title: The Pfizer vaccine, teenagers and myocarditis - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: 14 deaths were reported in the US after the Pfizer vaccine but the CDC concluded none were caused by the vaccine.

claims.text: Training a doctor costs £230,000.

claimReview.title: The cost of training a doctor - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is the overall cost of training a doctor according to the Department of Health. It isn't the cost to the taxpayer. £163,000 comes in non-repayable grants. Students will repay much of the rest, whether or not they work in the NHS.

claims.text: 96.3% of the Italy’s Covid-19 deaths were actually caused by other diseases.

claimReview.title: No, Italy hasn’t recounted its coronavirus data and found that most died from other diseases - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is incorrect. Official data shows that 96.3% of Covid-19 patients had other health conditions when they died.

claims.text: Ten minutes’ exercise each week cuts risk of early death by a fifth.

claimReview.title: Reports on the benefits of 10 minutes of exercise need a health warning - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Incorrect. A new study has found that American adults aged 40-85 who did 10-59 minutes of moderate physical activity per week (not just 10) had an 18% lower risk of dying than inactive adults during a follow-up period.

claims.text: Weekly death figures in late 2020 are barely higher than the maximum in the previous five years, once you adjust for population growth.

claimReview.title: The Daily Mail’s chart of Covid-19 death figures doesn’t use the real numbers - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is false. The figures used assume a level of population growth between 2019 and 2020 that is not credible.

claims.text: Money raised by Captain Tom Moore is only going to the NHS in England.

claimReview.title: It’s incorrect that the money raised by Captain Tom is only going towards the NHS in England - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Incorrect. Money raised by Captain Tom is going towards the Covid-19 appeal run by NHS Charities Together, which distributes money to charities across all four UK nations.

claims.text: Three Maryland coronavirus patients fully recovered and are able to return to everyday life.

claimReview.title: Good news coronavirus list needs context - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct. On 13 March 2020, Montgomery County, Maryland confirmed that three residents who previously had the virus no longer tested positive.

claims.text: The government has 'cut the deficit in half'.

claimReview.title: Factcheck: Has the budget deficit been halved? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The deficit as a percentage of GDP this year is forecast to be half its 2009/10 value, but this is not the case for the absolute value of the deficit.

claims.text: A photo shows sheep dyed by a farmer in Scotland.

claimReview.title: Some farmers dye their sheep, but a photo of a neon flock has been edited - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The photo has been edited, though farmers do sometimes dye their sheep for both practical and entertainment purposes.

claims.text: At the beginning of this year only 55% of people were getting their first payment on time, now that is over 80%.

claimReview.title: Is Universal Credit being paid on time? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct, for areas where universal credit is fully available. For all universal credit claims the figures were 65% in January and 76% in June.

claims.text: Sir Keir Starmer has never said that he wanted the UK to remain in the European Medicines Agency after Brexit.

claimReview.title: Keir Starmer did want the UK to remain in the European Medicines Agency - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not true. He said at least twice that the UK should seek to remain in the European Medicines Agency.

claims.text: While in the EU the UK can’t make trade deals on its own. This means it has no trade deals with Australia, New Zealand or the USA - or growing economies like India, China or Brazil. Instead of making a deal which is best for the UK, we have to wait for 27 other countries to agree it.

claimReview.title: Vote Leave "facts" leaflet: trade - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: EU member countries can’t make trade deals separately from the rest of the EU. The EU doesn’t have trade deals with the countries named but is currently negotiating with some of them.

claims.text: Albert Einstein said technology would one day “surpass our human interaction” and create “a generation of idiots”.

claimReview.title: Einstein didn’t say technology would create 'generation of idiots' - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There’s no record of him ever saying this. The first iterations of this quote appear to have been posted online in 2012.

claims.text: The Department for Work and Pensions wants to reduce the size of its estate by 20% but close 50% of Jobcentre Plus sites in Glasgow.

claimReview.title: Jobcentre closures - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct.

claims.text: The gender pay gap is at its lowest level.

claimReview.title: The gender pay gap has been falling over time - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Broadly correct.

claims.text: A picture shows an experiment was conducted to race cheetahs against greyhounds. When the cheetahs didn’t race the explanation given was that cheetahs had too much self-worth to race dogs.

claimReview.title: Cheetahs race greyhounds, sometimes - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Cheetahs have raced greyhounds in the past. When they don’t, it’s been hypothesised this could be for a range of reasons including motivation. The picture provided as evidence is from a car advert, not a real greyhound/cheetah race.

claims.text: HS2 will cut journey times to London by a few minutes for a few people.

claimReview.title: HS2 isn’t expected to cost as much as this post claims - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Official estimates suggest journey times will be cut more significantly, and currently forecast 300,000 passengers a day, although this is an uncertain figure.

claims.text: Illegal immigrants and refugees living in Britain get a yearly benefit of £29,900.

claimReview.title: Viral image about pensioners and refugees is wrong on every single number - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Incorrect. People who are staying in the UK illegally cannot claim any benefits. People living in the UK as refugees are entitled to the same benefit and pension payments as any UK citizen. This means it’s theoretically possible for them to get that sum, but it’s highly unlikely due to the benefit cap.

claims.text: Covid-19 vaccines have caused 172 miscarriages since January 2021.

claimReview.title: Website makes false claims about vaccines and miscarriages - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Miscarriages have been reported following vaccination, but there’s no evidence to show vaccines were the cause. The number of miscarriages reported after vaccination does not appear to exceed the number you would ordinarily expect.

claims.text: Employers cannot penalise workers who are following the law by quarantining after returning to the UK from abroad.

claimReview.title: It’s not true that employees who have to quarantine cannot be ‘penalised’ - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not correct. Employers can take action against employees, if they choose, including deducting pay.

claims.text: The proposed Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine is 90% effective.

claimReview.title: The Covid-19 recovery rate is not 99.9% - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is accurate according to early results, however, this could change when more results come out.

claims.text: Since 2000 we’ve given the EU £100 billion more than we’ve got back.

claimReview.title: This claim about the UK's EU contribution is correct, but meaningless - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Broadly correct. Since 2000 the UK has made a net contribution in cash terms of £109 billion. That’s £122 billion in real terms.

claims.text: The government are putting £34 billion into the NHS, the biggest ever cash injection.

claimReview.title: Boris Johnson’s first interview of 2020: fact checked - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is the spending increase between 2018/19 and 2023/24 in cash terms, but that’s not the most meaningful way to look at it. In real terms it’s a spending increase of £20.5 billion and that’s not a record level.

claims.text: Molnupiravir is actually ivermectin with a different name.

claimReview.title: Molnupiravir and ivermectin are not the same - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Incorrect. While both drugs are produced by Merck, they are different medications.

claims.text: For every donation the charity organisers take 1.98% off the fee plus 20p per each donation.

claimReview.title: The Maytrix Group receives no money from Captain Tom’s fundraiser - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: JustGiving charges payment processing fees for card and Paypal payments, charged at 1.9% of the donation plus 20p. The charge is 2.9% plus 20p for donations in other currencies.

claims.text: Modern medicine cannot cure any condition without surgery.

claimReview.title: Moderna’s Covid-19 vaccine will not change your DNA - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not true. Modern medicine can treat and cure many conditions in many ways.

claims.text: The UK spends £14 billion a year on “foreign aid”.

claimReview.title: How does UK foreign aid spending compare to NHS donations - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This figure is slightly out of date. In 2019 the UK spent £15.2 billion on foreign aid.

claims.text: The Covid-19 vaccine contains a nanobot transmitter which can connect you to the “internet of things”.

claimReview.title: Hecklers at Twickenham Stadium vaccine drive spout false claims - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The Covid-19 vaccines contain nanoparticles, which is just another word for very small natural or manmade particles. They are not “nanobots”, and cannot connect to WiFi or send data.

claims.text: The charity organisers on JustGiving are called Maytrix. The people who own or set up Maytrix are Captain Tom’s daughter and son in law.

claimReview.title: The Maytrix Group receives no money from Captain Tom’s fundraiser - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: While Captain Tom’s daughter did help him set up his fundraiser, and along with her husband is a director of the Maytrix Group, the company receives no money from the fundraiser.

claims.text: Mask mandates preventing access to food, healthcare or education are a war crime, according to the Nuremberg Code.

claimReview.title: The Nuremberg Code doesn’t state that mask mandates are a war crime - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is false. The Nuremberg Code doesn’t say anything about masks.

claims.text: 48,000 illegal immigrants stay in hotels.

claimReview.title: Figures for people seeking asylum in hotels and veterans sleeping rough are both wrong - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is false. It uses a figure for people seeking asylum (not illegal immigrants) in accommodation, but they are not all in hotels. The number of people seeking asylum staying temporarily in “contingency accommodation”, which can include hotels, is closer to 1,000.

claims.text: A sticker by Extinction Rebellion says driving a car makes you a Nazi.

claimReview.title: This is not an official Extinction Rebellion sticker - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not an official Extinction Rebellion sticker.

claims.text: The Conservative government has cut benefits for more than two children in a family unless the mother can prove she was raped when that child was conceived.

claimReview.title: What is the "rape clause"? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The Conservative government has introduced a two-child cap on the per-child payment under Child Tax Credit. There are five exceptions to this cap, including an exception for conception during non-consensual sex or sex in an abusive relationship. The criminal offence of rape doesn’t have to be proven but evidence of non-consensual sex related to conception must be provided.

claims.text: There are 600 more A&E consultants, 1,500 more A&E doctors, and 2,000 more paramedics.

claimReview.title: Staffing in A&E - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: These are roughly correct, comparing since 2010.

claims.text: CNN used a photo of one of the vaccine recipients back in October.

claimReview.title: False claims about first vaccine recipients spread on social media - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: It did not. CNN’s website has rolling news video at the top of some of its articles reflecting the current news, not the news at the time of that particular article’s publication.

claims.text: Liaison therapy has been rolled out to over 90% of A&Es, of which half are open 24/7.

claimReview.title: Mental health crisis care - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is correct, although only 13% of hospitals offer what’s called a ‘core 24’ standard of service.

claims.text: The Health Select Committee has said that the government's extra funding for health is actually £4.5 billion rather than £10 billion.

claimReview.title: £10 billion or £4.5 billion: what's going on with NHS spending? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is correct for funding over this parliament. Overall health spending will increase by £4.5 billion, after you take inflation into account. The £10 billion includes an extra year of spending and only refers to the NHS England budget rather than wider health spending.

claims.text: Ribble Valley is the happiest place in the UK.

claimReview.title: 182 places could be happier than the “UK’s happiest place” - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: It had the highest average happiness rating, in an ONS survey of all UK local authorities in 2018/19. But because scores are expressed as a range between two numbers, 182 local authorities could actually be happier than Ribble Valley.

claims.text: 53 million tests means that they have 53 millions people’s DNA on file.

claimReview.title: Viral influencer video full of false Covid-19 claims - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is wrong. No record of the patient’s DNA is taken in the testing process and the majority of test samples are destroyed.

claims.text: 90,000 women are raped in the UK every year.

claimReview.title: Sexual violence and domestic abuse - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There is no way of knowing exactly. Estimates suggest 90,000 woman a year were victims of rape, attempted rape and sexual assault offences in England and Wales. An estimated 50,000 women were raped, rising to 70,000 including attempted rapes.

claims.text: Before recent reforms, fewer than one in 10 stops and searches led to an arrest. Now the rate is the highest on record.

claimReview.title: Stops and searches are becoming less common - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct. Figures from 2008-2011 showed 9% of all stops and searches resulted in an arrest. By 2015/16, this was up to 16% - the highest on record.

claims.text: Net migration is the highest it has ever been.

claimReview.title: The Conservatives’ migration record - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is correct. It hasn’t changed much since last year.

claims.text: Type 1 diabetes is listed as a side effect on the MMR vaccine package insert.

claimReview.title: Evidence shows there is no link between the MMR vaccine and diabetes - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating:
Diabetes is listed as an adverse reaction on the MMR II vaccine used in the USA. This isn’t the same as a side effect – it can refer to conditions developed by chance after someone has been vaccinated but which aren’t caused by the vaccine. 

Neither of the two MMR vaccines used in the UK list diabetes in their information and evidence shows there is no link between the MMR vaccine and Type 1 diabetes.

claims.text: The UK is the largest investor in the US economy.

claimReview.title: UK-US trading and investment: a special relationship - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct. UK-based companies invested around $541 billion in the USA in 2017, based on official US figures. That made it the top investor in the country.

claims.text: Jacob Rothschild owns a patent to coronavirus.

claimReview.title: There is no patent for the Wuhan coronavirus - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Incorrect. There is no patent to the new coronavirus discovered recently in Wuhan.

claims.text: The new Covid-19 vaccine will be the first of its kind ever. It will be an mRNA vaccine which will literally alter your DNA. It will wrap itself into your system. You will become a genetically modified human being.

claimReview.title: mRNA vaccines are being developed for Covid-19, but they do not change your DNA - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: mRNA vaccines are some of the many vaccines being developed to combat the Covid-19 virus. However, they do not alter a person’s DNA.

claims.text: The spike protein generated by a Covid-19 vaccine can leave the site of injection and enter the bloodstream, which could possibly be causing deaths and vaccine injuries.

claimReview.title: Claims that Covid vaccine spike proteins are harmful are unevidenced - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There is some evidence that the spike proteins generated by the Moderna Covid-19 vaccine leave the site of injection. There is also evidence that the spike protein on the actual virus can damage cells that line blood vessels.  However, the two different spike proteins behave very differently in the body, and so the assumption that spike proteins generated by the vaccine could also harm cells in the bloodstream is unevidenced.

claims.text: The withdrawal agreement means any future free trade agreement between the UK and EU would make the European Court of Justice the ultimate arbiter of disputes.

claimReview.title: No indication that the European Court of Justice would be the arbiter of all disputes in a future UK-EU trade agreement - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The UK and EU haven’t started negotiating the free trade agreement yet so we can’t know for sure. Both sides have stated that under a future trade agreement the court would only arbitrate disputes on EU law that couldn’t be resolved by a joint committee.

claims.text: The majority of free schools have been opened in areas where there is a need for school places and in areas of disadvantage.

claimReview.title: Are there enough school places being created? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: 83% of free schools opened since 2013 were in areas where there was a need for places. We’ve asked the Department for Education for more information about the claim that the majority of free schools were opened in areas of disadvantage.

claims.text: Hate preacher Abu Hamza was a drug dealer who called for death to the queen and faced no action for his crimes.

claimReview.title: These claims about radical Muslim preachers and Tommy Robinson are mostly incorrect - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: We could not find evidence of Hamza selling drugs or calling for the death of the queen specifically. He was sentenced to life in prison by the US authorities and has served time in the UK for soliciting murder and inciting racial hatred.

claims.text: Vaccinating children against Covid-19 would probably do more harm than good.

claimReview.title: An influencer muddled his maths on vaccines for children - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating:
According to the JCVI, vaccinating children would probably do more good than harm.

This is especially true of children with an underlying health condition.

claims.text: Black scientists hold only 3.5% of professor posts.

claimReview.title: MailOnline muddles professorship ethnicity figures - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Incorrect. In 2018/19 black academics held just 0.5% of STEM professor posts, but 3.5% of black STEM academic staff were professors.

claims.text: Test and Trace cost 10 times more than the mission to Mars.

claimReview.title: Test and Trace has much larger budget than Mars Perseverance expedition - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This needs context. Test and Trace has a budget of £22 billion but the last figures, to October, show just £4 billion had been spent. NASA expects to spend £1.9 billion on the Perseverance rover.

claims.text: One in three girls in school uniform has been sexually harassed in public.

claimReview.title: 35% of girls wearing school uniform have been sexually harassed in public - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: 35% of 14-21 year-olds in the UK said they had experienced unwanted sexual attention or unwanted sexual or physical contact while wearing school uniform in public, according to a survey for Plan International.

claims.text: A photo shows Fidel Castro holding a baby Justin Trudeau.

claimReview.title: This picture does not show Fidel Castro holding Justin Trudeau as a baby - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The baby in the picture is Michel Trudeau, the PM’s late brother. The photo was taken on 1976 trip to Cuba, when Justin Trudeau would have been four.

claims.text: The Liberal Democrats were the first party to call for an in/out referendum on the UK’s EU membership.

claimReview.title: Were the Lib Dems the first party to campaign for an EU referendum? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Incorrect. The Referendum Party called for a referendum in the 1990s. The earliest call we’ve seen for a referendum from the Lib Dems was in 2007.

claims.text: Trade union sign up for those aged between 25 and 34 is 17% and for those aged 16 to 25 it’s 5%.

claimReview.title: Union membership among young people - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not quite correct. 13% of the UK population aged 25 to 34 were union members and employees in 2015 and 4% of those aged 16 to 24. Ms Andrews meant to refer to the proportion of trade union members in these age groups. 5% of trade union members were 16 to 24 in 2015 and 18% were aged 25 to 34.

claims.text: The government spent £356 million on Buckingham Palace.

claimReview.title: How much of this meme on government spending is true? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Almost—the refurbishments will cost £369 million. This will be funded by an increase in the Sovereign Grant (that’s money from the Treasury that comes from the profits of the Crown Estate).

claims.text: More people are waiting more than four hours to be seen in A&E since the Conservatives took power.

claimReview.title: A&E waiting times - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The number of people waiting four hours in all types of A&E in England in 2015/16 is higher than in 2010/11. More people are going to A&E but the percentage of people seen within four hours has also fallen.

claims.text: Sadiq Khan worked for the Nation of Islam.

claimReview.title: Sadiq Khan was a solicitor for the Nation of Islam - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct. He was a solicitor for the group back when he was a human rights lawyer.

claims.text: Increasing the international health surcharge to £625 and extending it to all foreign workers, including EU migrants after Brexit, will raise over £500 million a year.

claimReview.title: Claim that immigrants “only” pay £400 surcharge to use the NHS ignores their tax contributions - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: It’s unclear how the Conservatives have calculated this figure. We’ve asked for more information.

claims.text: The NHS had a deficit of over £800 million last year and is predicted to have a £2 billion deficit this year.

claimReview.title: Hospitals in the red: the size of the NHS provider deficit - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is correct for NHS providers. It stood at £830 million last year and it's expected to rise, with some forecasting £2 billion or more in 2015/16.

claims.text: One in six asylum seekers didn’t meet with border officials and have vanished.

claimReview.title: Have 12,000 asylum seekers vanished in the UK? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Almost 12,000 asylum seekers, or around one in six, are listed as having their case “On Hold” but the Home Office says this includes people who missed a first asylum interview and attended later, rather than vanishing. Its data doesn’t make this clear.

claims.text: Ethylene oxide is used to sterilise lateral flow tests. Ethylene oxide is not safe.

claimReview.title: Lateral flow tests are not unsafe - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Exposure to ethylene oxide can be unsafe. However, it is commonly used to sterilise medical equipment, including lateral flow tests, and does not pose any danger in this way.

claims.text: The government’s EU leaflet distributed before the referendum said that leaving the EU meant leaving the single market.

claimReview.title: The Conservative manifesto on the single market - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The leaflet didn’t say outright that leaving the EU meant leaving the single market. It did contrast the advantages of “full access” to the market that the UK has as a member of the EU with the uncertainty and lack of full access that might occur if the UK voted to leave.

claims.text:
It was the Mayor’s choice to raise the level of the London congestion charge in response to a bailout package offered by the government.

The government had only asked the Mayor to bring forward proposals to raise the charge as a bailout condition, not to actually raise the charge.

claimReview.title: Shaun Bailey’s comments on the congestion charge lack context - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating:
While this is technically accurate, it is misleading to suggest that the Mayor could have simply brought forward proposals, kept the charge as it is, and still receive the bailout.

The government’s bailout for TfL was conditional on TfL “urgently bring[ing] forward proposals to widen the scope and levels of these charges.”

claims.text: You cannot catch Covid-19 person to person or touching surfaces.

claimReview.title: Almost all of these claims about viruses are wrong - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is incorrect. There’s evidence that Covid-19 and other coronaviruses, like the common cold and SARS, spread in these ways.

claims.text: Even if you have purchased your car you don’t technically own it, you are just the keeper, and your car paperwork proves this.

claimReview.title: Registering as a car’s keeper doesn’t automatically mean you don’t own it - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not true, and misunderstands the purpose of car registration—which should be in the name of its regular user. The V5C document is not proof of ownership.

claims.text: The new UK-Japan trade deal will deliver a £1.5 billion boost to the UK economy.

claimReview.title: £1.5bn GDP boost from UK-Japan trade deal is not on top of existing EU-Japan deal benefits - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: These estimated benefits are relative to 2018 when the UK (as part of the EU) had no FTA with Japan. It’s not relative to the existing EU-Japan trade deal which currently governs trade between the UK and Japan.

claims.text: In November 2021 there were 29 house buyers for each property in the UK

claimReview.title: Data likely overstates the number of house hunters per house - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This analysis likely overstates the ratio of house buyers per property.

claims.text: The Oxford/AstraZeneca vaccine contains human foetal cells.

claimReview.title: There are no human cells in the AstraZeneca vaccine, and it won’t give you a chimpanzee virus - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There is a process involved in producing the vaccine which uses clones of cells which were originally derived from an aborted human foetus. But as the cells are clones, they are not actually from a foetus themselves.

claims.text: More than half of criminal trials in England and Wales have to rescheduled or called of.

claimReview.title: Cracking up: efficiency in the criminal courts - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct.

claims.text: A video showing body bags lying on the floor of various rooms inside a hospital was filmed in St Mary’s Hospital, London.

claimReview.title: This video of body bags in a hospital was not filmed in St Mary’s, London - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Incorrect, the hospital trust confirmed it wasn’t filmed there. It was filmed in Ecuador.

claims.text: Since the mid-1990s house prices have gone up nearly three times.

claimReview.title: How much more difficult is it to buy a home? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct. From 1996 to 2018, the average UK house price increased by around 300%.

claims.text: A peer-reviewed paper from Stanford University shows face masks don’t work.

claimReview.title: Error-strewn paper claims face masks are ineffective and harmful - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The paper isn’t from Stanford and is strewn with basic errors.

claims.text: The number of hospital beds for people with acute mental health conditions has fallen by 30%.

claimReview.title: Mental health: there are fewer beds, nurses and psychiatry trainees than in 2010 - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: These years aren’t comparable due to a change in collection method from 2010. Between 2010 and 2017 there was a 22% drop.

claims.text: The single issue that voters in this country care about is immigration, and this issue of migrants trying to get here is at the top of voters’ concerns.

claimReview.title: Peston claim that immigration is top public concern based on his own findings - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not mentioned as the top concern facing this country in the most recent Ipsos MORI or YouGov polls.

claims.text: £4,300 cost to UK families if Britain leaves the EU.

claimReview.title: The £4,300 question: would leaving the EU really make every household worse off? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: At best that’s a red herring. Most economists seem to agree that leaving the EU would cost the UK economically but this amount is an unhelpful summary of the underlying research.

claims.text: A PPE shipment was destroyed at the Port of Dover after illegal immigrants were found travelling alongside it.

claimReview.title: There’s no evidence immigrants caused a PPE shipment to be destroyed at Dover - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There is no evidence this happened, and the authorities at the port say the claims are false.

claims.text: We can't attract junior doctors from around the world because they won’t actually earn enough to meet the minimum income requirements.

claimReview.title: Are junior doctors paid enough to get a UK visa? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: A first-year junior doctor typically earns £26,500, rising to £31,000 in their second year. To get a visa, most non-EEA junior doctors usually have to be earning £30,000, or £20,800 if they’re under 26. However, at the end of 2017 the threshold was effectively £55,000.

claims.text: Scientists knew about the new coronavirus long ago and called it “Disease X”.

claimReview.title: The World Health Organisation did not know about the Covid-19 virus before the current outbreak - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: They didn’t. This is a misunderstanding about the phrase “Disease X”, which the WHO used to denote an unknown serious new disease that might cause a pandemic.

claims.text: Our mortality rate remains much the same as others.

claimReview.title: Several coronavirus claims made by MP in newspaper are inaccurate - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: In the week to 11 January, Our World in Data reported the UK had the fourth highest rate of Covid-19 death in the world. John Hopkins University said it had the eighth highest.

claims.text: Wetherspoons is offering a “meal for two with drinks” voucher to celebrate the lifting of Covid restrictions.

claimReview.title: Wetherspoons Covid-19 reopening deal is fake - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: It’s not. Wetherspoons has confirmed the offer isn’t genuine.

claims.text: Polypodium hydriforme parasites are in the Covid-19 vaccine.

claimReview.title: There are no parasites in the Covid-19 vaccines - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The Covid-19 vaccines do not contain parasites.

claims.text: There is only a 0.26% chance of catching Covid-19.

claimReview.title: The asteroid which might enter Earth’s atmosphere on 2 November will not “hit” Earth - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Incorrect. The US CDC published figures suggesting the chance of dying from Covid-19 after being infected was 0.26% and has since updated these figures. The chance of catching Covid-19 is much higher than that in many countries, including the UK.

claims.text: In 2010-11, there were 3.5 million children living in relative poverty. Today, the figure after housing costs is 4.2 million.

claimReview.title: How poverty rates are cherry-picked to score political points - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Broadly correct. In 2010/11 the figure was 3.6 million (27% of children), and in 2018/19 it was 4.2 million (30% of children).However, if you measured from 2009/10, when the proportion was also 30%, there would be no change.

claims.text: Before the EU referendum George Osborne claimed up to 820,000 jobs could be lost within two years if Britain chose to leave.

claimReview.title: What’s happened to employment since the vote to leave the EU? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct. Mr Osborne did claim this. He was referring to Treasury analysis which said the worst case scenario following a leave vote could increase the number of unemployed people by 820,000.

claims.text: Phase three trials for Covid-19 vaccines haven’t been done.

claimReview.title: Influencer video full of untrue vaccine claims - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is untrue. Analyses of data from phase three trials for all three Covid-19 vaccines (Pfizer/BioNTech, Oxford/AstraZeneca, Moderna)  authorised for use in the UK have been published in peer-reviewed studies in medical journals.

claims.text: Both the UK and Irish governments want to see free trade continue across the Irish border.

claimReview.title: EU customs union and the Irish border - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: They do, but it’s not their choice to make, because Ireland is bound by EU trade policies.

claims.text: There has been a rise in deaths from heart disease.

claimReview.title: The heart disease death rate isn’t increasing - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Incorrect. The number of under 75s in the UK dying from heart disease increased slightly between 2016 and 2017. But the total number of deaths from heart disease decreased.

claims.text: Under the new withdrawal agreement, UK fishing waters are not returned to the UK and EU members still fish UK waters.

claimReview.title: We fact checked this viral image on Boris Johnson's Brexit deal - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The latest deal doesn’t change anything to do fisheries, compared to Theresa May’s deal. The UK is due to leave the Common Fisheries Policy so will be an independent coast state.

claims.text: Late diagnoses in A&E are due to GPs missing signs of the disease.

claimReview.title: There are some mistakes in these figures about lung cancer diagnoses - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There is some research suggesting that GPs may miss some symptoms of lung cancer, but this isn’t the only reason for diagnoses following an emergency presentation.

claims.text: Almost 5.5 million British people live permanently abroad.

claimReview.title: More context is needed for these “facts about immigration” - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is based on an out-of-date estimate. A more recent estimate puts the number at just under five million.

claims.text: Relative child poverty has increased for three consecutive years and now stands at 4.1 million, or 30% of children.

claimReview.title: Child poverty is increasing and decreasing at the same time—here’s why - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct, looking at relative poverty after housing costs. Over the long term, absolute child poverty in the UK is down while relative child poverty is stable, after housing costs.

claims.text: William Wilberforce, the MP who campaigned to abolish slavery, was a Tory.

claimReview.title: Was William Wilberforce a Tory? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Wilberforce was an independent MP, though he was fairly loyal to the Tory Prime Minister, William Pitt the Younger.

claims.text: Hand sanitiser is effective against Covid-19.

claimReview.title: Experts say soap and water is preferable, but high alcohol sanitiser does work - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Hand sanitisers with 60% alcohol content and above are effective against viruses, such as the new coronavirus, but soap and water is the best option.

claims.text: Covid-19 vaccines are poison.

claimReview.title: Covid-19 can be fatal and tests for it aren’t rigged - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The NHS says that the Covid-19 vaccines approved for use in the UK have “met strict standards of safety, quality and effectiveness”.

claims.text: Fewer knife crime offenders are facing jail.

claimReview.title: It’s very unlikely that fewer knife offenders are facing jail - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is very likely to be wrong. It’s actually likely that more offenders are facing jail for offences involving possession or threatening with a knife. This claim is based on provisional figures which don’t include all cases that will result in jail sentences.

claims.text: 50% of cases in some Crown Courts are sex cases.

claimReview.title: Sexual offences in court - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: We haven’t seen figures yet to substantiate this. We’ve asked the Ministry of Justice.

claims.text: The average farmer made £28,300 in subsidies last year and £2,100 from agriculture. The average cereal farmer lost £9,500 on agriculture.

claimReview.title: Do farmers make more from subsidies than agriculture? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The basic point is correct. Last year farmers did make more from subsidies on average than from agriculture. Whether or not the exact figures are correct depends on whether you look at subsidies or all payments that farmers receive from government schemes.

claims.text: MPs get free holidays.

claimReview.title: What can MPs claim on expenses? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: MPs do not receive publicly funded holidays, but can receive hospitality from other organisations and foreign governments.

claims.text: The number of children in temporary accommodation is up 60% since 2010.

claimReview.title: How many children are homeless in England, Scotland and Wales? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct for England. Across Great Britain as a whole, the increase is slightly less.

claims.text: The deficit is down by nearly two thirds.

claimReview.title: Is the deficit down by two thirds? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is correct, looking at the deficit as a proportion of GDP. Between 2009/10 and 2015/16 public sector net borrowing decreased from 9.9% of GDP to 3.8%, or by around two thirds.

claims.text: A new study shows hydroxychloroquine can increase Covid-19 survival rates by 200%.

claimReview.title: Hydroxychloroquine study not all that it seems - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This very small study has not been peer-reviewed and it does not show that hydroxychloroquine can effectively treat Covid-19.

claims.text: Over 55,000 deaths have been caused by the Covid-19 vaccines.

claimReview.title: Miscarriage does not occur in 90% of vaccinated pregnant women - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There seems to be no evidence for this claim, and reports of adverse events from the Yellow Card Scheme and VAERS make clear that reported reactions are not necessarily the result of the vaccine.

claims.text: UKIP want to privatise the NHS.

claimReview.title: Does UKIP want to privatise the NHS? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: In its 2015 manifesto UKIP said that it wants to keep the NHS free at the point of delivery. Nigel Farage has suggested introducing an insurance-based model of healthcare in the past, but has since said that UKIP wants it to be free for British nationals and funded through general taxation.

claims.text: We have cut further education budgets by 50%.

claimReview.title: Spending for adult skills fell by 40% between 2010 and 2015 - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Incorrect. Spending on core adult skills fell by 40% in England between 2010/11 and 2015/16, taking inflation into account. Changes to funding make recent comparisons more complex but the overall picture is that non-apprenticeship core funding is set to fall slightly between 2016/17 and 2019/20, and adult apprenticeship funding is set to significantly rise.

claims.text: Margaret Thatcher once said anyone on a bus over the age of 25 is a failure.

claimReview.title: Did Margaret Thatcher say bus users over the age of 25 were failures? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: We can’t prove whether she did or didn’t say it, but she definitely didn’t coin the phrase.

claims.text: BBC presenters removed their poppies during a broadcast.

claimReview.title: BBC presenters did remove their poppies as they were wearing them earlier than BBC guidelines allow - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is correct. It happened as the poppies were mistakenly worn before the date set out in BBC guidelines.

claims.text: The people trying to cross the Channel from France to the UK are not refugees.

claimReview.title: Do refugees have to stay in the first safe country they reach? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This cannot be known. It will be determined by immigration officials who review their asylum applications.

claims.text: The Canadian government is introducing a social credit scheme.

claimReview.title: Canada is not implementing a social credit scheme - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not happening. It is a misinterpretation of advice given to Canadian businesses that operate in China where a social credit scheme exists.

claims.text: Around a dozen other European countries have banned zero hours contracts.

claimReview.title: Zero hours contracts: is the UK "the odd one out"? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Not all have an explicit ban, but it’s correct that most EU countries outlaw these contracts, heavily restrict them, or don’t see them widely used. The UK is one of around half a dozen European countries where zero hours contracts are both legal and fairly common.

claims.text: Almost a third of children aged 2 to 15 are overweight or obese.

claimReview.title: 28% of 2-15 year olds in England estimated to be overweight or obese - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: An NHS survey estimates that 28% of children aged 2 to 15 in England were overweight or obese in 2016.

claims.text: A photo shows Jeremy Corbyn at an IRA funeral.

claimReview.title: Jeremy Corbyn did not attend an IRA funeral wearing an ‘I heart the IRA’ t-shirt - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The photo has been edited to include Mr Corbyn.

claims.text: The BBC and British media are not reporting on strikes in France.

claimReview.title: Pension strikes in France have been widely reported in the UK - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Incorrect.

claims.text: A newly qualified teacher’s salary was £21,500 in 2010 and £22,000 in 2018.

claimReview.title: Pay rises: how much do nurses, the police, teachers and MPs get paid? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: These figures don’t take account of inflation since 2010. In 2018 prices, a new teacher’s salary in a local authority-run school in England and Wales (outside of London) was £25,400 in 2010, and is now £23,000.

claims.text: There were 334 fire deaths in England (including 71 at Grenfell). This is the worst year for fire deaths since 2010/11.

claimReview.title: How many people die in fires? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There were 334 fire-related fatalities in England, including 71 the Home Office counts as occurring as a result of Grenfell Tower fire. The last time this was higher was 2010/11 when there were 335 deaths.

claims.text: A video circulating on WhatsApp called “India is doing it” can hack your phone in ten seconds if opened or seen.

claimReview.title: WhatsApp messages about a video called “India is doing it” are a hoax - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This message is a hoax. Messages with similar wording about Argentina have also been debunked by fact checkers.

claims.text: Aborted male foetal cells called MRC-5 are in the Covid-19 vaccine.

claimReview.title: There are no foetal cells in the AstraZeneca Covid-19 vaccine - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The cell strain referenced isn’t used to manufacture the vaccine. A different cell strain, derived from kidney cells taken from a female foetus aborted in the 1970s was used to propagate the virus for the vaccine. These cells don’t make it to the final product.

claims.text: Most studies suggest that immigration has no significant effect on overall employment, or British unemployment.

claimReview.title: More context is needed for these “facts about immigration” - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: That’s a fair general reflection of UK research. Most studies show little or no effect on employment or unemployment of UK-born workers, but it can depend on the state of the economy.

claims.text: Free schools are being opened in areas that do not need them.

claimReview.title: Most, but not all, free schools help meet demand for school places - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: It depends what you mean by ‘need’. 83% of free schools since 2013 have been opened in areas that need extra school places, but free schools can also be opened with the intention of driving up standards. Across this parliament, the Department for Education expects about half of new places in mainstream free schools to create spare capacity in their local area.

claims.text: 52 free horses need rehoming in Ohio because their owner died of Covid-19.

claimReview.title: A viral Facebook post about 52 free horses is a repost from 2011 - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: They don’t. This is a repost of a genuine appeal from 2011, following the death of a horse owner.

claims.text: British 65 year-olds in 2019 knew rationing.

claimReview.title: These claims about people of certain ages remembering parts of World War Two are generally incorrect - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Unlikely. Rationing ended in July 1954, the same year most 65 year-olds were born.

claims.text: It takes people in Germany four days to produce what people in the UK take five days to produce. This means they need to work fewer hours.

claimReview.title: Productivity: are we keeping up with Germany? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct. On average, German workers took around four hours to produce what UK workers did in five hours in 2016. Workers in the UK work longer days on average than German workers, so overall UK workers were 8.5% less productive than German workers in 2016.

claims.text: The number of social rented homes fell by 420,000 under Labour.

claimReview.title: Labour's affordable housing record - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This refers to all homes rented from councils and housing associations. We don’t know what exactly happened to homes for the cheapest “social rent” specifically under Labour, but more of them were built on average between 1997 and 2010 than since 2010.

claims.text: In real terms over the last three months, wages have gone down not up.

claimReview.title: Marr wrong to claim PM wasn’t telling the truth on wages - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Between April 2021 and July 2021 total pay remained stable, while regular pay fell 0.6% in real terms.

claims.text: 201 of the 210 households have accepted or moved into temporary or permanent housing.

claimReview.title: Two thirds of former Grenfell households are not in permanent homes - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The most recent figure as of 17 May is 202, according to Kensington and Chelsea Council.

claims.text: More than half of net migration to the UK comes from the EU.

claimReview.title: Vote Leave "facts" leaflet: migration - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Estimated net migration of citizens from the rest of the EU is actually slightly lower than net migration from the rest of the world—not more than half.

claims.text: 90% of infected people have no symptoms

claimReview.title: This post telling healthy people to stop getting tested is full of inaccuracies - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The asymptomatic rate is uncertain, although one recent study suggested that 76% of infected people had no symptoms on the day of their test.

claims.text: Having 10 or more sexual partners increases cancer risk by 90% for women and 69% for men.

claimReview.title: Women who have had 10 or more sexual partners do not double their risk of getting cancer - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There is no evidence that having 10 or more sexual partners causes cancer in men or women.

claims.text: 82% of birds on earth are chickens.

claimReview.title: How many birds are chickens? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Around 4-12% of birds are chickens and other poultry, but, by mass, they account for around 70%.

claims.text: A Survation poll for Esher and Walton shows the Liberal Democrats polling ahead of incumbent MP Dominic Raab.

claimReview.title: Survation didn’t say the Liberal Democrats are polling ahead of the Conservatives in Esher and Walton - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Survation’s poll wasn’t of the constituency, it was a national survey of voting intention which was then used to model an estimate of what local voting could be – this might not be reliable.

claims.text: President Obama plans to stand in the Kenyan presidential elections.

claimReview.title: President Obama does not plan to govern Kenya next - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: He doesn’t. This is a joke.

claims.text: £1 in every £10 that goes to the NHS is to pay off debts from Private Finance Initiatives (PFIs).

claimReview.title: What is the NHS paying for Private Finance Initiatives? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This isn’t correct according to the latest cost estimates. These suggest ongoing annual costs are about 2% of the NHS budget, or £1 in every £55.

claims.text: In the last four years the number of patients whose transfer from hospital was delayed due to problems with social care has increased by one third.

claimReview.title: Social care and delayed transfers from hospital - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: That is correct for 2011/12 to 2015/16.

claims.text: The Westinghouse Springfield site produces nuclear fuel that generates 15% of UK electricity.

claimReview.title: 21% of UK electricity comes from nuclear - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: That’s what the power company itself says. Overall, nuclear sources supply about 21% of the UK’s electricity.

claims.text: Vaccines interfere with your DNA.

claimReview.title: Godfrey Bloom video makes false claims about vaccines - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Vaccines do not interact with your DNA in any way.

claims.text: Jeremy Corbyn said he’d abolish student debt before the election.

claimReview.title: Student debt: what did Labour say? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Mr Corbyn said he would “deal with it” in some way, and was looking at ways to reduce it, or abolish it, but also said there wasn’t a firm policy on it. Some media outlets and other MPs went further.

claims.text: The energy market is mainly owned by the French government.

claimReview.title: Who owns Britain’s trains, energy and postal service? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The French government is a major shareholder in the energy company EDF but not in any of the other Big Six providers. Other international companies have stakes in other members of the Big Six.

claims.text: A 1989 medical textbook lists the common cold as a disease caused by coronaviruses.

claimReview.title: Covid-19 is not the same as a common cold - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: True but coronaviruses are a family of viruses we’ve known that humans can get since the 1960s. Some cause the common cold. SARS-CoV-2 causes Covid-19.

claims.text: A no deal Brexit means we wouldn’t have to make any more annual payments of £26 billion to £32 billion.

claimReview.title: What does a “WTO rules” Brexit look like? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating:
If we leave the EU without a deal, it’s uncertain how much we’d have to pay the EU, if anything. But suggesting that we pay £26 billion to £32 billion per year at the moment is incorrect. 

Between 2011 and 2017 our net public contribution to the EU budget ranged from £8 billion to £11 billion per year.

claims.text: Covid-19 is not killing people.

claimReview.title: Covid-19 can be fatal and tests for it aren’t rigged - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: ONS figures show that since March 2020, over 128,000 people in England and Wales have died with Covid-19 listed as the underlying cause of death on the death certificate.

claims.text: In that 6 months, 2,000 people have died with no financial help whatsoever.

claimReview.title: This claim that 2,000 people have died waiting for benefits since a Universal Credit review was announced needs context - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Around 17,070 people died over five years, waiting for a decision on their Personal Independence Payment (PIP) application. Researchers used this to get an average of 1,700 over six months. PIP is one type of benefit people with a terminal illness can get.

claims.text: EU members can be forced to leave the euro or the EU.

claimReview.title: Is Grexit legal? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Countries can leave the EU voluntarily, but can't be kicked out. Strictly speaking, there's no legal mechanism for a country to either leave or be ejected from the euro.

claims.text: Independent inspectors say that driver-only trains are safe.

claimReview.title: Rail dispute: are driver-only trains safe? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: That’s the conclusion of the Rail Safety and Standards Board, and the Office of Rail and Road, who both say that such systems are safe provided that appropriate procedures are in place. Trade unions disagree, and deny that either organisation is actually independent.

claims.text: An elderly lady in the Doncaster area is looking for her niece, called Daphne.

claimReview.title: Why a Facebook post about an elderly lady looking for her Scottish niece keeps going viral - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There is no reason to doubt the validity of this claim, although it has been reposted several times, and the original post was made on 28 March.

claims.text: Theresa May changed the law to remove protection from Commonwealth citizens and Diane Abbott voted against the change.

claimReview.title: How immigration law changed for Commonwealth citizens - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Diane Abbott did vote against the law that changed the rules for Commonwealth citizens. The government disputes that this removes protection.

claims.text: An analogy about red and black ants in a jar and society was made by Sir David Attenborough.

claimReview.title: No record of Sir David Attenborough talking about red and black ants in a jar - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There is no evidence Sir David ever made this analogy.

claims.text: A viral video shows England and Italian fans clashing at Wembley after the Euro 2020 final.

claimReview.title: Viral Euro 2020 video shows football fans pushing into Wembley Stadium - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is untrue. The clip was shared online before the match started, and appears to show fans inside the stadium fighting with other fans who pushed their way in. Some members of both groups are wearing England apparel.

claims.text: 190,000 Muslim women, or 22%, speak little or no English.

claimReview.title: 22% of Muslim women say they don’t speak English or don’t speak it well - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is based on census data from 2011. 22% of Muslim women said they speak English "not well" or "not at all". For Muslim men the equivalent figure was 10%.

claims.text: Pfizer is using children as lab rats to test the Covid-19 vaccine.

claimReview.title: Adolescents have been recruited for Covid-19 vaccine trials in the US - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: 2,000 children in the US have been enrolled in Covid-19 vaccine trials in the US.

claims.text: Contributions from health workers paying the immigration health surcharge help us raise about £900 million.

claimReview.title: How much have healthcare workers paid through the immigration health surcharge? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: £900 million is the total amount raised by the immigration health surcharge – paid by some international UK residents – over four years. It is not the amount paid solely by health workers and carers.

claims.text: ‘How to hit a woman so no one knows’ was Googled 163 million times during 2020.

claimReview.title: Claims 163 million people searched ‘how to hit a woman so no one knows’ are untrue - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is false. This is the number of search results, rather than the number of times that the term was searched for—a methodological error acknowledged by the researcher behind the claim.

claims.text: 3.3m people diagnosed with diabetes in the UK in 2013/14, whilst an additional 590,000 are undiagnosed.

claimReview.title: Diagnosis unknown: how many diabetes cases go undetected? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: GP practice registers support the 3.3m figure, but the methodology and reliability of the undiagnosed figure is more uncertain.

claims.text: Boris Johnson refused 50,000 ventilators offered by the EU.

claimReview.title: No, the UK didn’t turn down 50,000 ventilators offered by the EU - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not true. The UK did not join an EU scheme to stockpile medical equipment, but this is not the same as turning down 50,000 ventilators.The total budget of the scheme wouldn’t have covered this many ventilators.

claims.text: Nine out of 10 NHS trusts are unsafe.

claimReview.title: Hospitals: safety versus quality - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is referring to BBC analysis of published figures finding 137 of 152 NHS trusts had bed occupancy above the recommended 85% between 1 December 2016 and 22 January 2017.

claims.text: A video of several strategically placed room fans keeping a paper aeroplane flying in a circle shows what happens “when physicists get bored”.

claimReview.title: A video of several fans making a paper plane fly is CGI - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The video was created by a video animator called Vernon James Manlapaz, and does not show a real event.

claims.text: Covid-19 is not a pandemic.

claimReview.title: Social media video makes false claims about Covid-19 - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: False. Covid-19 was declared a pandemic by the World Health Organisation in March 2020.

claims.text: After the election debate on ITV between Boris Johnson and Jeremy Corbyn, ITV and the BBC quoted the only poll which didn’t find Jeremy Corbyn to be the winner.

claimReview.title: Twitter polls are not accurate opinion polls - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: All the polls which found Corbyn to be the winner were conducted on Twitter, meaning they are not designed to represent the general population and are largely meaningless. The BBC and ITV reported on a YouGov poll which was designed to do this and so is meaningful.

claims.text: Covid-19 does not exist as a virus, but rather a bacterium that has been exposed to 5G radiation.

claimReview.title: Claims about Russia, Covid-19 and 5G are almost all false - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is false. Covid-19 is caused by the virus SARS-CoV-2. 5G has nothing to do with Covid-19.

claims.text: A poll has shown that Britain wants to quit the EU.

claimReview.title: Poll does not prove Brits want to quit the EU - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The survey wasn’t representative, so doesn’t tell us much about what voters as a whole want. Taken together, polls have so far suggested a slight lead for the ‘remain’ camp so far.

claims.text: The government has protected the budget for schools.

claimReview.title: Experts agree school funding is falling per-pupil - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: That was correct in the recent past, and in the near future in terms of the overall amount. But per-pupil funding once inflation is taken into account is set to fall over the next few years.

claims.text: The government broke a pledge to open GP surgeries from 8am to 8pm, seven days a week.

claimReview.title: GP opening hours—five years of pledges - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: While the pledge appeared in the Conservative 2010 manifesto, it wasn't in the coalition agreement.

claims.text: Matt Hancock owns the company responsible for supplying the NHS.

claimReview.title: Any health secretary will be the owner of this NHS supply company, not just Matt Hancock - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: He owns it in his capacity as Health Secretary, not as a private individual. Any Health Secretary after him will also own it.

claims.text: There are 790 more prison officers since the beginning of 2015.

claimReview.title: The number of frontline prison officers is falling - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is wrong because it’s just looking at the number of people being appointed and the number of people leaving. It doesn’t factor in people who are promoted or re-graded within the service, or the hours they work. The number of prison officers is falling.

claims.text: A seven-year-old boy called Lachlan Leary died from the Covid-19 vaccine in Sydney.

claimReview.title: No evidence Australian child ‘Lachlan Leary’ died from vaccine - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There is no evidence to suggest this is true. Official sources have denied the claims, and Full Fact could find no trace of the story reported via reputable news outlets.

claims.text: Rail fares are out of control.

claimReview.title: Are rail fares out of control? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The average rail fare in Britain has increased by 20% in real terms since 1995, though it dropped by 1%, factoring in inflation, between 2017 and 2018.

claims.text: You can meet with both of your parents at the same time, as long as you stay two metres apart.

claimReview.title: New lockdown guidance doesn’t mean you can see both parents at once - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is wrong. You can only meet with one person from outside of your household at a time.

claims.text: 12 to 13 million people will die through a combination of lockdown, flu and vaccine-driven pathogenic priming.

claimReview.title: Trafalgar Square “Freedom Rally” speech littered with false claims - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating:
There is no evidence this will happen. Even the largest figures do not put the potential health impacts or mortality rates attributable to lockdown or flu anywhere close to this figure. 

Pathogenic priming, also known as antibody-dependent enhancement, is a very rare condition and there is no evidence any of the Covid-19 vaccines cause it.

claims.text: Spain wants money from the UK to cover its debts.

claimReview.title: Viral post has flawed understanding of EU debt - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: We’ve seen no evidence it has asked for this, and the amounts Spain receives from the EU budget are a tiny fraction of its debt.

claims.text: The police starting salary was £24,000 in 2010 and £23,000 in 2018.

claimReview.title: Pay rises: how much do nurses, the police, teachers and MPs get paid? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: These figures don’t account for inflation. In 2018 prices their starting salary has fallen from the equivalent of £27,400 in 2010 to around £23,300 in 2018.

claims.text: Kary B Mullis, inventor of PCR tests, said they cannot detect free infectious viruses.

claimReview.title: PCR tests are not ‘a fraud’ - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This quote does not come from Mullis himself, but from an article about him. PCR tests accurately detect particular viral genetic material, such as genetic material of the virus that causes Covid-19, rather than testing directly for infectivity.

claims.text: We can get a standstill in our current trade arrangements with the EU under Article 24 of GATT, while we negotiate a free trade agreement.

claimReview.title: Boris Johnson repeats an old line about “GATT Article 24” - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Article 24 does not remove the need to strike a deal with the EU, and experts have said an agreement using this is unlikely to happen.

claims.text: Myocarditis acquired after a Covid-19 vaccination is more dangerous than that acquired after a Covid infection.

claimReview.title: Evidence suggests myocarditis risk after Covid-19 vaccination is lower compared to Covid infection - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Evidence actually shows you’re at greater risk of myocarditis after Covid-19 infection and may experience worse clinical outcomes.

claims.text: A second wave of Covid-19 is being planned and the vaccines will kill people.

claimReview.title: Viral instagram video falsely claims Covid-19 was planned - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Both claims are false.

claims.text: There were 8,244 full time equivalent health visitors in the NHS as of December 2017, the lowest number since August 2013.

claimReview.title: Health visitor numbers in England down by a fifth since 2015 - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct, for the NHS in England.

claims.text: An estimated 2m young people in their 20s and 30s can't find the money needed to move out of their parent's home.

claimReview.title: How many young people could benefit from Help-to-Rent? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: In 2013 there were 2.4m people between the age of 20 and 34 who both lived at home and had a job. Their specific reasons for not having moved out are not known though.

claims.text: Members of the Royal Family would not have attended the England vs Germany Euros 2020 match if there actually was a “deadly pandemic”.

claimReview.title: Royal attendance at Euros does not prove there’s no pandemic - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There is clearly a real pandemic. Covid-19 has killed more than 150,000 people in the UK and the Euros match was managed to reduce infections.

claims.text: A photo shows a baby who was born with their heart outside their body and they receive money every time the post is shared.

claimReview.title: Sharing picture of baby with rare heart condition will not raise money - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The photo is of a baby born in 2017 and there is no evidence any money is raised by sharing the image.

claims.text: Four males in Bootle took an air ambulance helicopter without consent (otherwise known as joy-riding).

claimReview.title: Police tweet about helicopter joy riders in Merseyside is fake - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Merseyside Police confirmed this is not true and the tweet claiming this was fake.

claims.text: There is reason to suspect that people who died in care homes were probably euthanized using midazolam.

claimReview.title: False claims from funeral director about facemasks, vaccines and the pandemic - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: People have died in care homes during the Covid-19 pandemic. While midazolam is often used in end of life care, there is no evidence to suggest that this has been used with the intention of killing people, or as part of a euthanasia policy. Euthansia remains illegal in the UK.

claims.text: Health tourism costs nearly £300 million on some estimates.

claimReview.title: Health tourism savings won't plug the hole in NHS funding - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Correct.

claims.text: Flu caused more deaths in the UK than Covid-19 did between 19 June and 31 July.

claimReview.title: A graph spreading on Facebook gets it wrong on flu vs Covid deaths - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This compares how many death certificates mentioned flu and/or pneumonia, compared to those which mentioned Covid-19. This doesn’t mean they were mentioned  as the underlying cause of death. There are almost certainly fewer deaths where flu is the underlying cause compared to Covid-19.

claims.text: There is human blood in vaccines.

claimReview.title: There are no mouse brains in Covid-19 vaccines - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Some vaccines use an ingredient called human serum albumin, which is derived from human blood. But the blood from donors is screened before use to prevent any contamination.

claims.text: 90% of all trade through the Port of Southampton is to and from non-EU countries.

claimReview.title: Southampton MP gets trade figures wrong - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: In 2016 it was estimated that 90% of exports (by value) from the Port of Southampton went to non-EU countries.

claims.text: Wages flatlined for more than 10 years.

claimReview.title: Marr wrong to claim PM wasn’t telling the truth on wages - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: After the financial crisis wages fell until 2014 and then started to recover, only recently reaching the levels recorded before the crisis.

claims.text: 9,472 people were admitted to hospitals in England with the Delta variant of Covid-19 in the seven days to 29 August.

claimReview.title: Newspapers report Covid hospitalisations over seven months as over seven days - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: False. 9,472 people were admitted to hospitals in England with a confirmed case of the Delta variant of Covid-19 in the seven months to 29 August. This only included overnight stays.

claims.text: Beta-Propiolactone is in vaccines and is known to cause cancer, suspected gastrointestinal, liver, nerve and respiratory, skin and sense organ poison.

claimReview.title: This image about vaccine ingredients is extremely misleading - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: It may be present in trace amounts of some vaccines. It is potentially carcinogenic, but only in much larger amounts than would be in a vaccine.

claims.text: The EU has a 40% tariff on food from Africa.

claimReview.title: The EU doesn’t have a 40% tariff on African food imports - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: False. There isn’t just one flat tariff on food. Regardless, the EU doesn’t apply tariffs on the vast majority of African countries, due to trade agreements and efforts to support developing nations.

claims.text: Accounts on Twitter resharing a post about journalism failing to capture the mood of the country is a coordinated bot effort.

claimReview.title: It seems unlikely the accounts resharing a viral post about the UK press are bots - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: We cannot find evidence for this.

claims.text: M62 and M60 cameras went live on 8 January and clock you at 72mph.

claimReview.title: This claim about cameras and speed limits on the M60 and M62 isn’t quite true - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Cameras on the M60 and M62 have been in operation since 1 January 2019. But the national speed limit is still 70mph.

claims.text: Food, clothing and footwear make up the highest proportion of the poorest households’ spending.

claimReview.title: Will getting rid of EU tariffs help the worst off? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: What makes up the biggest chunk depends on how you categorise people’s weekly spending. These items combined make up about a quarter of the poorest households’ spending.

claims.text: The Brexit withdrawal deal doesn’t guarantee we’d stay in a customs union.

claimReview.title: Brexit withdrawal deal and future trade deal—what’s the difference? - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Technically correct, but the withdrawal agreement isn’t meant to deal with future trade. It does outline a backup trade deal which involves something similar to a customs union, but the permanent future trade relationship is a matter for future negotiations.

claims.text: The UK has the lowest recycling rate in Europe.

claimReview.title: Corbyn incorrectly says UK has worst recycling in the EU - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Incorrect. The UK’s recycling rate is about average among EU countries.

claims.text: Klaus Schwab has been arrested in Switzerland for crimes related to the pandemic.

claimReview.title: WEF founder Klaus Schwab has not been arrested - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not true, and has been denied as “fake news” by spokespeople for the police.

claims.text: A video shows the last moments of the Ethiopian Airlines flight that crashed killing 157 people.
